column1: fantastic start, full around off, attacking the stumps, the ball takes the outside half towards gully. Philander will keep making Bancroft play
on a length around off, pushed to mid-on from the crease. Again, forced to play
full and wide outside off, 128 kph, no need to play. Quinton's first action, he seems to have hurt his finger as he collects
beauty, pitches around off and because Bancroft has moved across, he feels he needs to play. He doesn't need to. Moves away and beats the edge.
129 kph, big appeal. Philander appeals vociferously, but there was too much bounce. Good length around off, the ball moves away and beats the bat again, struck on the back thigh. High, says Faf.
drifts down leg, 129 kph, looking for the one that tails back in. An ODI wide, but Bancroft will be happy this ain't an ODI.
beauty! Play that, Dave. 135 kph, full delivery, pitches outside leg and darts away like an offbreak. Warner holds his bat in line, the ball beats the bat. A wide smile on Warner's face.
138 kph, drifts down leg and Warner opens his account with a flick down to fine leg. One. Loud yelp of 'noo' for the second.
a full delivery outside off, not much movement, easy enough for Bancroft to let go
full delivery outside off, seams back in, 137 kph, let go nicely. A confident leave, a very good stroke.
full and straight, 137 kph, driven away to mid-on. Nice timing.
full outside off, the ball seams back in, 137 kph, defended
he's always there. 129 kph, good length delivery outside off, the ball pitches and moves away to beat the bat. No chance for Warner. He didn't go chasing though.
full on middle and leg, the ball comes back in, 128 kph, defended back this time.
full on middle, nicely bowled, 128 kph, Warner strides forward to block.
almost hits off stump! 126 kph, full outside off, fourth-stump channel. Warner lets it go, nice judgement.
around off on a length, 129 kph, defended to cover. A loud no
that's a bit too full and Warner punches a drive past mid-on for a couple. 127 kph, around middle, driven away past Faf. Some rain and so, a slow outfield.
full and wide, too wide to even make Bancroft think about playing a stroke. Left alone.
that's better, 139 kph outside off, and full. Asking Bancroft if he'd like to drive. He says not yet.
143 kph, full outside off, the ball moves back in. Another leave.
another positive leave. 136 kph, back of a length outside off, Bancroft knows where his off stump is so he lets that one go.
140 kph, well bowled, on middle and leg, a thick inside edge towards backward square leg. That's a good line. Faf says in Afrikaans that it's a good length too.
terrific bowling, 140 kph, full outside off, Warner wants to drive, as he usually does. But the ball pitches, moves away and beats the bat.
back of a length around off, Bancroft stays back and pushes it back up the pitch, 129 kph.
on the pads, 127 kph, Bancroft misses a flick, hit on the pad, ricochets away towards fine leg.
126 kph, short and wide outside off, Warner opts to leave
well bowled, 127 kph, full and straight, Warner gets forward to block.
that's short and wide, 126 kph, slashed away towards a short mid-off. Warner won't be happy with that, missing out on four runs.
128 kph, another tight over, 128 kph, full and straight, off the pad into the leg side.
a full delivery, seams away. Bancroft wants to lift his bat to leave, but the ball hits the withdrawing bat
a nice defensive block. 137 kph, full outside off, Bancroft comes forward and blocks to mid-off.
another nice leave, full and wide, 142 kph, left alone
too straight this time, 137 kph, on middle and leg, driven away towards mid-on
opened up! 143 kph, on middle and leg, Bancroft looks to flick but the ball moves away, takes the leading edge towards point.
139 kph, that's too straight. Bancroft misses a flick, off the pad down to fine leg. It's a maiden. Bancroft just seems to be missing many off his hips. Should have got bat on that.
can't premeditate leaves against Philander. Full outside off, the ball cuts back in, goes between bat and pad as Bancroft brings his bat down late after wanting to leave
excellent bowling. Full outside off, the ball pitches, moves away and beats the bat.
full around off, 126 kph, defended back to the bowler
that was in the driving slot but Bancroft misses. 126 kph, full and swinging outside away, the ball somehow beats Bancroft on the inside edge. Played for more swing than there was
127 kph, back of a length around off, defended into the mid-on region.
another single off the last ball of the over. Full around middle, comes back in. Bancroft plays, gets an inside edge down to fine leg for one.
short down leg, Bancroft lets that one go
good length around off, defended back up the pitch
that's too straight and clipped away through midwicket for the first boundary of the day. On the pads, big vacant regions.
a good leave, back of a length outside off, 140 kph, left alone
back of a length outside off, moving away, left alone nicely
too wide, asking Bancroft to drive. Nothing doing. Another leave.
on middle and leg, 126 kph, nudged away into the midwicket region.
over the top of off? 128 kph, around off, the ball climbs and bounces over the stump. Good leave.
full outside off, 128 kph, tapped away towards backward point for nothing.
that's a bit too straight, 126 kph, around off, hit away towards cover
full and moving away, swing. 128 kph, no reason to play that. Good leave
too wide again, full and wide, left alone. A wasted delivery there.
on the pads, Warner looks to flick, but can't make contact, hits the bat, a leading edge.
drifts down leg this time, on the pads, strikes the pad down to fine leg for one
back of a length outside off, takes the outside half towards gully.
132 kph, full delivery outside off, Bancroft plants his front foot forward and defends
full and swinging away, the ball pitches and moves away, another leave. Good discipline from Bancroft.
full around off, 130 kph, blocked towards mid-off. Another maiden.
a full delivery, swings back in, hits Warner on the pad but sliding well down leg!
excellent bowling, full and lulling Warner into a defensive prod. Then the ball pitches and moves away.
back of a length on middle, hit back up the pitch
too straight again, drifts on the pads, hits Warner's thigh pad, then towards square leg
that's the one that seams back in. Another big appeal, high says Faf again. It pitches and comes back in, hits Bancroft on the back thigh. Looks very straight, but just a tad high.
127 kph, full outside off, Bancroft plays the line, off the outside half towards gully.
back of a length outside off, 130 kph, hit towards mid-off
full and angled away, good delivery. 131 kph, left alone. Fantastic discipline from these two.
good half-stop from Philander. 136 kph, back of a length down leg, pulled away to square leg. Philander dives ti his right to prevent the ball from going through
full and wide outside off, too wide. Left
on the bounce to gully! Full on middle and leg, that line makes Warner flick, but there is some away movement. Takes the leading edge
another good half-stop. On the pads, 131 kph, Warner misses a flick, the ball ricochets off the pad towards de Kock, who dives to his right to save three.
that's a good line, 126 kph, full outside off. Not on middle and leg. The ball comes back in, a solid block back.
a thick inside edge, full on middle and leg, 129 kph, more inward movement. Off the inside edge into the pad
a good length delivery, 126 kph, a waft from Warner. Thick inside edge down to fine leg for one.
zoning in on that off stump, full around off, pushed to mid-on
back of a length outside off, pitches and moves away, no stroke.
full and wide outside off, keeps moving after pitching. Bancroft still not driving.
full and wide outside off, 133 kph, left alone
full and wide outside off, Warner looks to drive but the ball hits the inside edge towards mid-on. That defensive mindset changing to attacking, but no timing
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off. Too full.
a full delivery outside off, 135 kph, pushed in front of mid-off for a single. Good run.
too straight this time, nudged away into the gap at midwicket. Another boundary in that region for Bancroft.
back of a length outside off, left alone.
short of a length on leg stump. Leaps to get on top and whip this to fine leg
short of a length and just outside off. Lots of time to spring onto the back foot and dab this in front of point
overpitched on leg stump, Warner leans in and tickles it off his toes to give Maharaj a despairing chase. He loses to the ball. That's his first boundary
good length just outside off, tentative push forward to defend
short of a length outside off and he nudges it past gully. Rabada hasn't got any movement this over
full and in at off stump. Gets too far across with the front foot and has to hurriedly open the face to poke this to extra cover
length and slanted across the corridor. Left alone
length on the pads. Deflected behind square as he looks to flick
wafts and is beaten. Locked on the front foot again, this time against a bouncer outside off. Hardly has any room as he goes for the upper cut
shot. Nicely in position this time as the length ball slants into him. Leans in and punches it past mid-on
overpitched and in on middle stump. Nudged wide of mid-on off the toe-end
drilled through the covers. Australia cashing in after the drinks break. Overpitched from Ngidi and wide outside off. Warner extends his arms and hits through the line
length and in at leg stump, glanced to fine leg off the front foot
the bleeding continues. Warner watches this skid off the surface outside off and slaps it on the up through cover

outside edge flies through the third slip region! That fielder had just gone out to cover! Rabada gets this to move away off the surface, Warner hangs the bat out and gets a healthy edge that would've been to third slip's left
length outside off and he leans in to push this through the now-vacant cover region
superb hit. Through cover once again but this time with a lot more grace. Overpitched ball outside off, gets the weight into this nicely and holds the elbow high as he completes the shot
length and wide outside off, left alone
beaten. Wobbles away from a full length after Bancroft is drawn in for a cover drive

outside edge between third slip and gully. Once more he isn't close to the ball with the forward press and is driving on the rise. There's movement away off the pitch as the blade comes down for the drive
good length and in the corridor. Solidly blocked on the front foot
good length and wide outside off. Left alone

what a ball! That dream delivery for every fast bowler, outswinger, full and shaping away from middle stump. Bancroft closes the face too early on the flick and gets a leading edge that dribbles past gully
length and in at leg stump. Punched to mid-on off the front foot
length and lifting up at a fifth stump line. Left alone
good length and angled into the corridor. Left alone
sharp bouncer, but well left. Headed for his throat but he gets under it quickly
bouncer again, just outside off. Warner gets down on one knee to let it pass
good length on off stump, leans in and punches to mid-off
and another. Length ball wide outside off. Warner brings out the axe and duly sends this to the extra cover boundary to ruin yet another over for South Africa
short of a length outside off, cut straight to cover
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide outside off. Spanked to sweeper cover off the back foot
overpitched on off stump, driven straight to extra cover
thuds the thigh guard as he looks to whip through square leg. This is a length ball lifting into him
beaten on the outside edge. Bangs it in on a length again and nips it away off the surface. Loose attempt from the batsman
length on middle stump, nudged to mid-on
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
looks for the yorker but misses. It's a full toss and he taps it to mid-on
back of a length and shaping away outside off. Left alone
good length outside off, defended down the pitch
back of a length and spinning into the pads. He tickles it past short fine
good length on off stump, defended off the inside half
full outside off, defended on the front foot
full on off stump, driven straight to extra cover
tossed up outside off and one more he can't breach extra cover with a firm drive
chases and misses. Starting to offer some chances now, Bancroft. Length ball starts outside off and swings further away. He goes after it with a drive
pings the pad again, angling this in from a middle stump line. Bancroft late on the flick
good length and in the corridor. Defended to cover
length outside off, tapped wide of mid-off on the front foot
short of a length just outside off. Defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump. Warner misses as he looks to flick
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, driven to long-off
good length on middle stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
tossed up on middle stump, flicked to long-on
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
shifts his weight back and hammers this wide of square leg. It's aerial because he's through the shot early. Short ball on off stump and he doesn't swivel too much to hit it
beaten as he jabs at this on the front foot. It slants away from the corridor and past the outside edge
overpitched on off stump, lunges forward in a rush and drills this between mid-off and non-striker
full on off stump, leans in and punches on the front foot. Mid-off dives to his left to stop this, but can't hold on cleanly. That's fifty for Warner

inside edge and onto the back pad as this nips back in from outside off. He's looking to drive on the up. Shout for lbw is turned down as this trickles through the slip cordon after landing in front of Quinton de Kock's dive to the right
full outside off, leans in and caresses it wide of mid-off
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
classy. Length on middle stump, steps out to meet it at the pitch and clips it wide of mid-on with the angle
full on leg stump, driven to mid-on
good length and swung away outside off. Left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
length and shape away outside off, left alone

got him! If you sense vulnerability, you bring Vernon back! Bancroft over the last 20 minutes has been chasing deliveries outside off. Resisted thrice this over, but this one is fuller and moving away very late outside off. Draws him in, gets a thick edge and the keeper leaps to his right to take it
full outside off, left alone
another tidy end, full outside off. 125 kph, no stroke from Khawaja.
lovely stop Faf. Overpitched outside off, drilled to cover. Past Amla. Faf runs across from mid-off to his right.
flat outside off, slides on, left alone
flat and quick around off, 84 kph, right behind the line to defend
dropped! It doesn't stick! Slow outside off, flicked away to short leg. Doesn't even hit the hands, off the body. Markram the man.
flight outside off, driven away to long-on
very tidy end, flat around off, Warner is behind the line to defend.
drifts on the pads, 128 kph, down leg, off the pad to square leg. A leg bye.
full on middle and leg, 130 kph, nudged away to square leg. They won't want to give him room
inside-edged into the pad. 127 kph, full and straight, the ball moving back in, thick edge
full around off, 132 kph, no movement there. Warner is behind the line to defend
128 kph, full outside off, defended into the off side.
127 kph, full on middle and leg, a bit of a leading edge into the off side
flat and straight, nudged fine, past short fine leg for a couple
tossed up outside off, 83 kph, defended back.
short and flat and quick, clipped to short fine leg
another fine stop from Faf. Overpitched outside off, driven away to Faf's right at mid-off. He has saved six runs since lunch.
short and drifting down leg, nudged to short fine leg, 80 kph
another tidy over, 84 kph, clipped away to midwicket.
extracting a hint of lateral movement! On a length, around middle and leg, clipped to square leg.
full and wide outside off, 128 kph, left alone
holds its line! On a length outside off, 126 kph. Khawaja is careful of not leaving his off stump vulnerable so he plants his bat in line but the ball does not move. Beaten.

edged and gone! And again, it's the replica of the previous delivery. Full outside off, he could have let that one go, but Philander is getting some inward movement. So Khawaja has to cover his off stump. He pushes at the ball, hoping the ball would move back. But it does not. The last ball followed the same modus operandi to beat the bat, this ball catches the outside edge. Amazing bowling from the Big Vern.
full on off and middle, Smith walks right across, exposing all his stumps. Worked down to fine leg. Some oohs and aahs, settle down, he's in complete control, like he has been for the last 700 days.
a tad wider outside off, slashed to deep point
81 kph, flight down leg, nudged away to midwicket
runs down to the pitch and drives to cover.
flat around off, pretty quick too, defended back.
strays on the pads, somehow Warner misses a flick, struck on the pad.
full on middle and leg, 87 kph, driven to mid-off for one. Good single.
flat outside off, Smith goes right back and defends
127 kph, full on middle, blocked back.
very tidy, around off, 131 kph, blocked
124 kph, back of a length outside off, punched from the back foot towards cover. The tall Ngidi gets down to his right, and half-stops it. Warner comes back for three.
full outside off, the ball moving away. The Smith swat-leave.
full and wide, moving further away, left alone. Not as exuberant a leave this time
full on middle and leg, 124 kph, worked to square leg, followed by a 'noooot nowww'
83 kph, flat around middle and leg, defended
lovely control, 85 kph, full on middle, kept out.
comes charging down and drives to cover
flat around middle and leg, 89 kph, defended back.
he's had enough of plodding about against Maharaj. Comes charging down and launches a lofted drive over mid-off. Shot.
strays down leg, worked away to short fine leg. Wondering why Warner isn't interested in sweeping just yet, with fine leg up. A fingerspinner wouldn't get much bounce too, negating the top edge.
full and swinging away, left alone. This is a good strategy, let him leave and then you either stay there or bring it back in, like Dale Steyn to Steven Smith at this ground two years ago.
good length around off, defended away to mid-on
a length delivery around off, Smith tries to work the ball to square leg but the ball moves away, off the leading edge.

a huuuge appeal. A full delivery outside off, it comes back in prodigiously. Smith lets the ball go, it clips the side of the front pad as Smith offers no shot. HawkEye shows the ball is missing off stump.
full around off, defended to mid-on
full delivery outside off, the ball moves away, defended back. A maiden from Vern, excellent bowling.
flat and quick, on middle and leg, pushed back
overpitched on middle, 75 kph, another block.
quick and straight, the leg side line seems to be working to Warner. Defended.
very full around middle, 84 kph, smothered
comes down and shovels a flick to wide long-on. Rabada, as good an athlete as any in this team, stops two.
shortish outside off, 87 kph, punched to cover from the back foot.
short and wide outside off, slapped away to deep cover for two. That's a poor ball, he has to find his best soon to follow up a top spell from Vern.

gone through Warner! 132 kph. A fantastic move from Faf. A full delivery on middle and leg, this one does not move. Warner plays for some, goes through his defense, beating him on the inside edge to hit the top of middle and off. A fine knock from Warner, but SA now have an opening.
full, angled away, left alone
132 kph, a length delivery around middle, off the inside edge towards square leg.
shortish outside off, 129 kph, left alone
back of a length on middle and leg, Marsh is on top of the bounce to defend.
flat around off, slow too. 84 kph, right behind the line is Smith
nice and slow, but too full, defended
a low full toss on the pads and Smith clips him away through midwicket with ease.
better line, full outside off, 83 kph, defended
clipped away again, but bad timing, on the pads, nudged through midwicket. Amla labours after the ball
slow outside off, 79 kph, defended
fantastic bowling, full delivery outside off, the ball holds its line. Marsh lifts his hands to let that one go
back of a length on middle and leg, defended away towards mid-on
full and wide, angled away again, another nice leave.
dug in, the bouncer down leg, Marsh thinks of pulling, bails out of the stroke late. Good change in length.
good length and wide outside off, 129 kph, another leave
a maiden, 131 kph, on a length outside off, left alone by Marsh.
that's a poor ball, short and wide, scythed away to deep point for one.
flat outside off, 80 kph, goes through, nudged away into the leg side.
overpitched outside off, smothered back.
on the pads, worked away towards de Bruyn at square leg. He lets the ball go through.
slow outside off, Smith gets forward to smother the ball back.
too full there for Maharaj, full is fine if it's quicker. Too much time for Smith to get forward and push to long-on.
good length delivery outside off, Smith goes back and pushes the ball to cover.
130 kph, full around off, pushed to mid-on. A skip and jump and a not now to mid-on
back of a length outside off, 140 kph. Smith goes back and looks to punch the ball but the ball has been released from wider. The ball moves away and beats the bat. Stunning delivery
136 kph, full and wide outside off, no wafting this time, left alone.
back of a length outside off, 130 kph, he is perched on the back foot, pushed to cover
back of a length around off, Smith gets across and shovels the ball into the gap at square leg for two. A manufactured stroke.
full and straight, on middle and off, defended into the off side.
very tidy, zoning in on off stump. That's how you earn respect of batsmen if you're mid 120s, around off, blocked
on the bounce to gully, 124 kph, around off, a thick outside edge towards gully, who dives to his right.
beaten on the outside edge, 125 kph, on a length, the ball moves away prodigiously to beat the bat. All seam.
full on middle, moves away again after pitching, pushed into the off side
holds its line, back of a length, 122 kph, defended to mid-off.
full and just outside off stump. Drives halfway through his shuffle, off the back foot. Straight back to the bowler
good length and in at off stump. Defended from the crease
slashed away. Short and wide from Ngidi and he climbs over this quickly to get it past backward point
full and in at off stump. Driven straight to mid-off
good length and just outside off. Shuffles and leaves. That moved away off the seam
whipped to square leg, no fuss. Full ball speared in at off stump. He shuffles, allows it to come on late and picks it from about an inch in front of his back leg. Routine stuff
full and wobbling at an off stump line. Defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, watchfully pushed into the covers off the front foot
good length on middle stump. Tapped wide of mid-on to steal a single
good length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
good length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left with soft hands
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
bottom edge drops short of De Kock. Looks to cut this short ball outside off
inside edge to fine leg. Tentative forward press from Marsh as this slants across him
good length and in at middle stump. Tapped to midwicket from the crease
length on off stump, nudged to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length on off stump, solidly blocked on the back foot
short of a length on middle stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
floated up slow on a good length, very wide outside off. Stabs at it away from the body
loopy again, length on middle stump. Steps out and bunts it to the bowler
full on off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up slowly again and Marsh skips down the pitch to meet it on the full. Whips it to the midwicket boundary
short of a length and turning away from off stump. Punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length and in at off stump, punched to midwicket off the back foot
good length and big turn into the pads. Can't get bat on the attempted flick. It's deflected to short fine off the thigh guard
good length outside off, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
length outside off, steps out and pushes into the leg side
tossed up on middle stump, steps out and drives to long-on
short of a length just outside off. Left alone
shot. Glorious from Marsh. It's full outside off and he leans in to drive sweetly through the line, between extra cover and mid-off
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length on middle stump, dropped into the midwicket area with soft hands
short of a length and lifting up into his mid-riff. Unable to tackle this, cops it on the body
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
length on off stump. Leans in and flicks uppishly past short leg. Lost his balance as he was pressing forward there
full at off stump, defended into the covers
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
nicely bowled. Drifting in towards off stump at a length. Watchfully defended as it turns away
short of a length and angled across off stump, left alone
short of a length, pitching on off stump and it comes in as he leaves, away from the angle
length and outside off, left alone

oh yes. It's time for some aesthetics. Short of a length and pushed across off stump. Marsh shuffles, transfers the weight onto the back foot and kisses it goodbye before sending it on it's way with a square drive on the rise
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, left alone
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, defended into the off side
good length outside off, defended on the front foot

Maharaj is excited about this direct hit! It's been sent upstairs. Smith nudges this into the leg side with soft hands and they take a tight run. Square leg swoops down on it and throws quickly. Smith has grounded his bat and just made his ground

South Africa have reviewed an lbw decision. Marsh has stepped out and been struck on the pads after looking to flick. It appears he was outside off...it is. That's a quite woeful review. He was beaten in flight and that was hitting the stumps for sure, but he was well down the pitch and well outside the line
length outside off, steps out and pads into the off side
short of a length on leg stump. Dabbed behind square leg off the back foot
good length on off stump, blocked from the crease
short and into the ribs. Shuffles and pulls to fine leg
short of a length and into the corridor. Left alone
full outside off, punched to mid-off from the back foot

got him! Or has he? Smith reviews. He was struck right in front of the stumps and he appeared to be walking before the umpire gave it out...before deciding to stick around. It's a poor review too, he's plumb in front. Length ball angled in at middle stump. He shuffles and unlike his usual self, misses this on the inside edge. Back leg, right in front of middle stump. Rabada is in his face screaming 'yes!' multiple times. Big, big wicket. Has Rabada made contact with Smith there? Looks like their shoulders have bumped, but neither of them were moving deliberately for it
tossed up on middle stump, steps out and flicks to mid-on
back of a length and turning down leg. Deflected fine off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, cut to cover's left. Markram dives to stop
good length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, feet rooted in the crease as he looks to drive away from the body. Hits it aerially but it's wide of cover

Shaun Marsh reviews an lbw now. Rabada brings one in fiercely from around the wicket and he's caught off guard. Looks to flick and misses. He's right in front of middle stump during impact. Only the angle can save him...it won't. That's hitting the top of leg. Umpire's call.
inswinging yorker just outside off. Jams this into the pitch and feels that in the bottom hand
outside edge as this straightens in the corridor. Length ball and he's on the back foot

inside edge and it's another wicket! De Kock completes a low catch. Rabada is making it happen! Reverse swing on this, hooping in at a length from outside off. Looks to drive on the up and it kisses the bat on the way through

edged and gone first ball! Rabada on a hat-trick! Cummins must have been told multiple times in the dressing room to watch for the full, straight one. So he is crouching low, waiting for the ball to come to him but it doesn't. Instead, it pitches, moves away and takes the outside edge. Sensational bowling from KG.
full outside off, left alone by Paine.
full and wide, moving away, left alone.
full outside off, the ball moves away late and beats the bat.
that's better, full and wide outside off, driven away to deep cover for a couple.
full and straight, defended back.

full on middle and leg, the ball moves back in. Another massive appeal, no says the umpire Gaffaney. SSA want the review, and he makes the T-sign for the review. So Faf reviews. Is it clipping leg? Is it missing leg? Just clipping the side of leg stump says HawkEye, so SA don't lose their review.
a low full toss on off, pushed to mid-on. Was looking for that inswinging yorker, not a bad option.
full around off, Starc's leaden-footed drive goes to square leg, instead of cover, via the inside edge.
good leave from T-Paine. Good length in the fourth-stump channel. Paine lets that one go
that is a clever change in length, 139 kph, digs this in down leg. Paine thinks of pulling but is hurried for pace, left alone.
left on bounce! On length! 139 kph, back of a length around off, Paine lets that one go and the ball goes over off and middle stump.
full outside off, left alone this time.
a full delivery around off, pushed to mid-off from the crease. No third slip
full delivery outside off, 127 kph, punched to mid-off.
130 kph, full and wide outside off, chipped away past cover for a couple. Nicely played.
full and straight, 130 kph, the ball moves away, takes the outside half to deep point for one.
too straight, off the pad down to fine leg. Rabada runs across to his right to cut off the boundary.
a full delivery outside off, 130 kph, left alone by Paine.
a bouncer down leg, Starc lets that one pass by his right shoulder
full outside off, left alone. 138 kph.
a full delivery outside off, 138 kph, too much movement for a No. 9. The ball beats the bat comfortably
nicely hit. Too full and Starc drives through mid-off. That's the way to play, try and score as many as they can rather than occupy the crease.

five-for for Rabada. A word to Starc as he goes past. That's a jaffa of a delivery. On a length on off, Starc's feet are nowhere, but his bat comes down at an awkward angle, looking to flick, the ball moves away, beats the bat and clips the top of off stump!
back of a length outside off, 140 kph, lets the ball go past.
a full, wide delivery outside off, 131 kph, pushed back up the pitch.
full and wide outside off, the ball leaves Paine, left alone.
left alone outside off
good length delivery around off, Paine this time is right behind the line to defend.
good length delivery outside off, 129 kph, punched to cover.
that's a poor, last delivery. Full and wide outside off, the ball moving away. Paine laces a drive to the sweeper cover boundary. Sublime timing.
smashes him on the glove! 145 kph, short one, aimed at the badge, Lyon takes his eyes off the ball, brings the hand up and lets the ball hit the glove. Ouch.
137 kph, short down leg, Lyon thinks of pulling but the ball passes too quickly.
that's four. Full outside off, Lyon leans into one and drills a drive through mid-off.
full outside off, moving back in, hit away to mid-on
another short one, drifts down leg though. Lyon misses a flick.
back of a length down leg, off the pad as Lyon misses a clip.
short and wide, carved to the deep point fielder for one.
full and wide outside off, 126 kph, hit away to cover
straighter, on middle and leg, nudged away to wide mid-on for one.
a full delivery outside off, the ball pitches and moves away, tapped away towards gully.
good single, on a length outside off, 129 kph, tapped towards point for one. Nicely played.
full delivery outside off, driven away to mid-off
jags back in! Back of a length outside off, Paine inside-edges this towards the keeper. Almost chopped on.
full outside off, lets that one go.
nicely played that. Good length outside off, Paine opens the bat face and guides this ball through gully for four.
good length outside off, guided away off the open face to deep third man
short delivery outside off, Lyon gets on top of the bounce to defend, 137 kph.
no man there so four. Another short ball on middle and leg, Lyon pulls through square leg. Not the best timing, but he gets four. Australia have 200
nice and slow, on middle, Paine blocks.
on the pads, nudged towards midwicket for one.
flat and quick down leg, defended to mid-on
slow on middle and leg, 76 kph, nudged away into the leg side.
a wild swing and into the gap at midwicket for four. Wasn't quite in the slot but he went through with the stroke anyway.
nails the sweep this time. Some flight down leg, smashed away over midwicket. Falls just inside the boundary.
full around off, Paine opens the bat face and guides the ball to deep point
on a length outside off, 136 kph, the ball holds its line before beating the outside edge.
strays on the pads, drifting slightly. 134 kph, Lyon misses a flick.
full and straight, pushed to mid-on, 136 kph

that's the one. The ball that swings back in to nip in between bat and pad. Full and straight, swinging back in. Lyon cannot account for that movement, there is a huge gap between bat and pad. The ball ricochets into the stumps via the pad.
full on leg, a thick inside edge into the pad.
overpitched around off, 88 kph, driven back to the bowler
flat around off, cut away to backward point
flat and straight, nudged to midwicket
ooh, the drifter. 82 kph, comes back in, inside-edged into the pad.
short and wide outside off, 79 kph, carved away behind point. Amla can't get across to his left. Vital runs.
flat outside off, carved away to short third man. There's a direct hit from de Bruyn at the batsman's end, but Hazlewood has made it. Should not have been one there.
full outside off, too wide to draw a stroke, left alone.
too short, 136 kph, pulled down to fine leg. Paine refuses the single.
full and wide outside off, no stroke, 138 kph.
a good length delivery outside off, 136 kph, played to point
full outside off, blocked to cover.
a short delivery outside off, Paine looks to get underneath the length to carve the ball over the slips but no contact. He is distraught he didn't connect.
full, on off, hit to mid-on
on the pads again, worked to wide mid-on for one. Nicely played
full outside off, 130 kph, left alone
brings the ball back in, full and straight, defended
a full delivery outside off, 129 kph, the ball comes back in. But too wide to draw a stroke, left alone.
a low full toss on middle and leg, flicked away into the gap at midwicket for three. Maharaj chases it down and pulls it in, which means he saves one but Paine is back on strike.
back of a length around off, defended back.
a full delivery outside off is neatly driven to mid-off
slightly short and Paine picks the length and pulls to deep square leg. Looks to hit that in front of square but not good enough timing.
short and wide, 139 kph, Paine can't quite connect with a cut.
swivel-pulled away for four. 135 kph, short down leg. Paine picks the length and the gap behind square. Very vital runs.
a high full toss outside off, not a bad surprise delivery. Under the waist. Paine can't connect. He keeps Paine off strike for next over.
terrific short delivery, around middle and leg, Hazlewood has no idea where the ball has gone. It pops up by his feet and Paine calls him through.
full delivery outside off, 131 kph, defended to cover
smashed away for four. Very good cameo this. Short around off, he picks the length quickly, goes back and pulls over midwicket.
another bouncer, too well-directed for Paine to think of pulling, the ball goes past.
full outside off, 133 kph, outside-halved to deep point for a couple. Rabada not happy there was two runs there.
131 kph, full and straight, defended back. Well done by Rabada.
short, drifting down leg, an ODI wide
four more. 141 kph, overpitched outside off, Hazlewood leans into this and caresses it through mid-on. Fine shot.
full outside off, the ball moving away, 138 kph, defended to mid-on
more runs. This is poor bowling, full and wide. Hazlewood leans into the drive and nails it through cover. No one there.
digs this one in, down leg, 140 kph, Hazlewood gets under
short and wide, carved away to deep point for one.
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, pushed to extra cover on the front foot
length outside off, forward defence
tossed up on off stump, steps out and drives back to the bowler
full on off stump, driven to long-off's left
back of a length outside off, late cut to short third man's left. Can't get it past him but they get the single
short of a length in the corridor, steered to third man off the back foot
good length on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off

breaches the defence. That's the end of Tim Paine's resistance. Regulation length ball, pitching outside off and headed for the top of off. Paine looks to block on the front foot but he's left the gate open
good length and swinging away from off stump. Pushes away from the body to defend on the front foot
good length and shaping away outside off. Left alone
full and swinging away late from a middle stump line. Closes the face and taps it into the leg side
good length with a hint of outswing from the corridor. Leans in and watches it onto the blade to get one through the covers
full outswinger in the corridor, left alone
good length and just outside off stump. Dead-batted into the pitch off the back foot
back of a length outside off with a hint of shape away. Nudges it into the covers with soft hands
good length and swinging down leg side. Chases for the flick but can't connect
good length and in the corridor. Pushed to mid-off on the front foot
full outside off, deftly poked through extra cover on the front foot
short of a length with some shape away. Punched on the up to mid-off
good length and swinging away outside off, left alone
full outswinger from middle stump. Elgar in danger of getting squared up but he adjusts well to defend with soft hands

looks for the outswinger again, but this one starts at leg stump and keeps sliding down. It's full and Elgar jabs at it, with some loss of control as he's reaching out. It flies into the long leg boundary with two bounces
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length and in at middle stump. Watches it come on and takes his bottom hand off as he gets an inside edge
good length, in the corridor. Defended with an open face to gully
short ball outside off, left alone
good length with an angle into the corridor, and then it leaves him as he looks to defend. Unplayable
good length on off stump, plays close to the body as he defends on the front foot
beats the outside edge again. Different direction, same template. Angles it into the corridor and gets it to jag away
length and in at off stump. Left alone on height
nicely timed. Hazlewood errs in length and with the angle in, Elgar merely has to get to the pitch of the ball. Does that and clips this through vacant midwicket
good length with late shape away from the corridor. Dead-batted into the off side
full and just outside off stump. Defended down the pitch on the front foot
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length ball angled across him and he offers the full face to tap this through extra cover on the rise
full on middle stump, flicked to backward square leg
good length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
good length on leg stump, tapped to mid-on on the up
good length on leg stump, driven to mid-on
back of a length at the hips, glanced to fine leg
good length outside off, left alone
short ball, very wide outside off. Left alone
full and wide outside off. Feet planted as he slices to point
shot! Stylish straight drive from Markram. It's in the slot, full and just outside off. He brings down a short bat-swing and punches past his partner
ugly reach out and he yorks himself. Overpitched ball very wide outside off. No feet at all. Not that it mattered, that was too far out of reach anyway. Lucky not to edge that or slice off the toe
good length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length on leg stump, tapped wide of mid-on
short of a length on leg stump, pushed to square leg off the back foot
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot. Reaching out again
good length and in at middle stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
plumb! Markram's got one angled into him, and he's late on it. Stuck in the crease, falling over into the off side and struck on the knee roll. Not even a thought of reviewing that.
South Africa's <strike>pinch-hitter </strike> nightwatchman has chipped one neatly to the deep square boundary. Poor ball first up from Cummins. Full and on the pads. Leans in and picks up easy runs
back of a length outside off, hangs his bat out and is beaten
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
nearly drags this on. Tentative from Elgar. Looks to defend this length ball then decides he wants to leave. As he withdraws the bat, the ball has run off it's face and to the keeper
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
length and in at the thigh. Rabada looks to push into the leg side and gets it off the thigh guard
good length and slanted across off stump. Left alone
bouncer at a leg stump line. Ducks under it
length ball slanted across off stump. Left alone
shot! Grace from Rabada. Full on leg stump, stands tall and clips it through the open midwicket region with full balance
in the air and wide of catching-45. Short ball at the hips and he leaps off the floor to nudge this past short leg
good shot again. Length ball in the corridor. Not to the pitch but he plays close to the body and uses his reach. Punches off the outside half and gets a four through point
good length and in the corridor. Defended off the face, into the pitch
short ball across the corridor, drops the wrists and lets this go
steers it to the backward point boundary.  Short ball angled across off stump. Watches it come on and taps it with a high elbow between gully and point. They chase, they fail
back of a length outside off, hangs the bat out and guides it to gully on the bounce
length and in at middle stump. Firmly punched to mid-on, on the rise
good length outside off, defended to extra cover on the front foot
dropped short and it turns a long way outside off. Elgar's squared up and beaten by a long way
back of a length in the corridor, dead-batted into the pitch off the back foot
length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length and lifting up outside off. Soft hands as he defends
good length outside off, left alone
a full delivery around off, defended to mid-off
on the pads, clipped to square leg, 137 kph. No swing just yet.
through the inside edge! Full delivery outside off, 138 kph, Elgar hangs his bat out, the ball goes through a pretty big gap between bat and pad.
nice and straight, nudged down to fine leg for one.
nicely driven. Full outside off, driven away towards mid-off. The fielder dives to his left.
another lovely drive. 137 kph, overpitched outside off, crisply caressed to mid-off
full outside off, the ball moving away, nicely left alone.
beauty! It's closer to off stump, more towards the fourth stump. 139 kph, full delivery outside off, the ball moves away and beats the bat.
on middle and leg, nudged into the gap at midwicket, 140 kph, one run.
leading edge into the gap at point. 145 kph, full delivery on leg, he closes the bat face, the ball lobs away towards point.
an outside edge down to gully. On the bounce. Full outside off, Elgar plays the line, the ball takes the outside half.
lovely shot. on the pads and clipped in front of square for four. Too straight from Starc, he occasionally strays there.
a bit of an appeal, pitched outside leg. Full on leg, the ball beats Rabada on the inside edge, hits him on the pad.
good length delivery outside off, the ball holds its line and bounces a bit extra to beat the bat.
full outside off, 137 kph, left alone.
a nice change in length, goes short outside off, Rabada sways out of the way.
nice and straight, defended to mid-on from the crease. Not much movement early.
on middle and leg, the ball moves back in, 137 kph, nudged towards midwicket. Elgar forces Rabada to come back for two.
back of a length around off, the ball stays on its original path, defended back up the pitch
full and wide, swinging away, left alone. A bit of away movement there.
again asking Elgar to drive, full and wide, left alone.
full and wide again, another leave. 142 kph.
full and straight, skewed away off the inside edge towards square leg for a run
attacking the stumps again, full and straight, he is nicely behind the line to defend. Looking much better against Starc with the new ball, instead of the old ball.
137 kph, full around off, driven back to the bowler.
136 kph, full and wide outside off, hit away towards mid-off
full around off, nice and full, 141 kph, patted towards point.
digs this one in, short around off, 141 kph. Too short and so Elgar eases underneath
popped away into the gap at cover for three. Full and wide, Elgar's hard hands meets the ball, which is why it goes in the air. But safe.
on the pads, 137 kph, nudged away to deep square leg to retain strike
141 kph, back of a length around off, Rabada is opened up as he defends into the off side.
strays down leg, looking for the yorker, the ball goes down the leg side.
goes short, another nice change in length, 143 kph. Hurries Rabada, who gets underneath after taking his eyes off
back of a length on off, goes into the off side off the outside half.
full and wide outside off, 137 kph. A drive, a leaden-footed drive. The slip cordon thinks there is an edge. Mitchell Starc does not. Very far from the outside edge.
full outside off, the ball flies off the outside half towards backward point.
a good single, full outside off, just tapped into the off side for a run.
smashed for four through mid-off. Full outside off, he lets his hands through the line, the ball races away through the mid-off region!
short and wide outside off, 138 kph, Rabada flashes and misses. A bit of extra bounce on that one.
another lovely drive, 137 kph, but he picks out mid-off. Full and wide, Rabada is not moving his feet, but his hands are moving just fine.
goes short this time, around middle. Rabada ducks.
short and wide outside off, in the slot for a cut. Rabada tries but some extra bounce takes the top edge, the ball goes flying over gully. A nice 29 so far from KG
full around off, defended back, 142 kph.
nice and full again, blunted away. Important for SA to keep Starc away from the wickets
too straight from Starc and Elgar tucks him fine, four to the fine leg boundary. Too easy. This one doesn't move and an easy flick
too full outside off, jammed away to point
full outside off, close to off stump. Left alone awkwardly
full and straight, on middle, 142 kph, defended. 36 minutes safely negotiated.
you can expect this method of bowling. Short down leg, Rabada ducks underneath

chopped on! Cummins strikes. Back of a length outside off, his feet don't move. Rabada plays from the crease, the bat well away from the pad. He looks to defend, but the ball takes the inside edge, into the pad and then hits off stump. His head goes back in disappointment, but that's a nice contribution with the bat
through the vacant slip region for four. Full outside off, he plays at it with soft hands, the ball takes the outside edge, goes down and through gully.
full and wide, the ball moves away. Amla lets that one go
full around off, pushed in front of point for one. Tight single, but easily made.
the yorker, on off, 140 kph, jammed out.
short outside off, Amla wants nothing to do with that, lets it go through
full and wide, asking Amla to drive. It's too early yet so no driving.
full and wide again, another leave.
nicely played, overpitched outside off, driven away into the off side, through cover.
excellent bowling. Short around off, Amla drops his hands, lets the ball go through
full and wide, left alone.
outside off, too full. Elgar drills a drive through cover for three. Mid-off has to cut it off.
full outside off, a hint of away movement. Left alone watchfully
stunning delivery. Full outside off, the ball holds its line till the last moment, when it shapes away and beats the bat.
full outside off, defended into the off side.
short outside off, 139 kph, a hard length. Left alone.

143 kph. Pad before bat? Inside edge? Nonetheless, Amla has been given by umpire Ravi. He reviews. Pad, before bat? Hits the pad definitely before bat. Comes down to HawkEye, and the ball strikes Amla outside off. One green, all that matters for Amla. Amla was walking off but then saw HawkEye.
beaten on the outside edge. Slow outside off, the ball drops and beats the bat
looks for the sweep but makes no contact. The ball pitches around off and spins well away.
slow outside off, 89 kph, defended into the off side.
popped away towards mid-on. On middle and leg, just a chip. Can't be playing against the spin on this surface.
slow outside off, defended into the off side.
tossed up outside off, defended to point. A maiden to start.
good length outside off, left alone this time. The ball pitches and moves away.
full on middle and leg, 138 kph, pushed away to mid-on
full and wide, overpitched, left alone.
back of a length outside off, some extra bounce. Amla sways out of the line.
full outside off, 136 kph, defended into the off side.
good end. 137 kph, full and wide, swinging away, left alone.
short of a length and turning away outside off. Tapped to point off the back foot
beats the outside edge. Sharp turn away as he goes on the back foot to defend
length on middle stump, gets low and paddles aerially to short fine leg
full on leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
good length on leg stump, gets on the back foot and taps to short fine
back of a length and in at middle stump. Defended off the back foot
back of a length on leg stump, clipped past square leg who has slipped as he shapes to chase this down
yorker just outside off, jammed back to the bowler
good length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
beaten outside off. Length ball shapes away wide outside off and he wafts at it away from the body
shot. Overpitched and just outside off. No need of a big forward stride. Stands tall and punches it wide of mid-off
short ball lifting up in the corridor, left alone
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
length on middle stump, gets on one knee and reaches out a long way before sweeping off the low half of the bat
back of a length and fizzing away from the outside edge. He gets on the back foot and dead-bats it in front of slip
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
back of a length on off, defended off the back foot
back of a length on off, defended towards gully with soft hands
overpitched outside off and a mistimed drive to mid-on off the front foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
full and in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
full on leg stump, nudged to midwicket off the front foot
good length with some very late shape away in the corridor. Left alone
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up on off, blocked solidly on the front foot. 90kph that one
92kph now. Length and wide outside off. Turns away and he leaves
short of a length outside off. Mistimed cut to point
slider, good length and just outside off. Left alone
tossed up on off stump, driven back to the bowler
oh lovely from Amla. Big extension of the arms after his trigger movement and the balance fully presented as he punches on the up through cover
back of a length on leg stump, whipped to square leg
good length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
overpitched and down leg side. Reaches out and flicks to fine leg's left. Starc slides on his knees to stop
good length on off stump. Defended on the front foot
good length and in at leg stump. Flicked to short fine
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
flat and back of a length at middle stump. Defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on leg stump, dabbed to deep square off the back foot
slider outside off and Elgar leaves for the turn. Off stump exposed as he does this. Very close.
nicely bowled. Bit of wobble as he lands this on a good length in the corridor. Left alone
good length and in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
full and just outside off. A tad late on the drive, trickles out to mid-off
bouncer on middle stump. Ducks under it
good length outside off, left alone

length and angled in to leg stump. Allows it come on and nudges it neatly past square leg. Starc puts in a slide after sprinting from fine leg again to stop this...but his shoulder touches the boundary as he does so. That will be amended to four runs
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
back of a length outside off, left alone
full outside off, leans in and drives straight to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump, defended off the inside half of the bat
back of a length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
full and in at off stump. Wathcfully pushed pitch-side off the front foot
length on leg stump, nudged through square leg off the inside half of the bat. One-handed
good length and late swing away in the corridor. Left alone
good length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
shot. No runs. Overpitched on middle stump and driven back firmly at the bowler with the full face
bouncer across off stump, left alone
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, defended on the front foot
leading edge as he closes the face on this middle stump ball. Slow turn away again
length outside off, left alone
withdraws the bat as this beats the outside edge. Length ball turns away marginally as he looks to defend
good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
full on leg stump, leading edge past gully as he looks to whip this. Length ball pitches outside leg and cuts away off the pitch
length on leg stump, in control as he taps to mid-on
low full toss wide outside off, tapped to mid-off
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length and in at leg stump. Steered to short fine off the back foot
length outside off, steps out and drives to long-on with the turn
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, plants the front leg forward and flicks through midwicket
short of a length outside off, jumps up as he shuffles outside to defend
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length and swinging away outside off. Defended on the front foot
short ball just outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
yorker just outside off, jammed into the pitch on the front foot
short ball outside off, ducks under it
struck on the pad as he looks to flick. It's a full ball on leg and it's going down
good length outside off, struck on the pad and it pings to short leg where Bancroft dives one-handed to take it. But the appeal is turned down on both counts
good length and turning in sharply from outside off. Bat-pad down the pitch
back of a length outside off, tapped into the leg side off the back foot
length on middle stump, defended on the back foot
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
a low full toss outside off, 139 kph, pushed towards wide mid-off for a run.
full and wide outside off, left alone.
full outside off, 137 kph, left alone
full delivery outside off, left alone
on the pads, too straight, nudged away to deep square leg for a run
short outside off, the ball turning back in, Amla is behind the line to defend.
a shortish delivery around off, 89 kph, worked away towards short leg, the ball beats him for a run
slow around off, 88 kph, Elgar is right forward to defend.
lots of flight, maybe too full, smothered away into the off side.
good start from Lyon. Elgar gets right forward to defend.
full and wide, extracting just a hint of away movement. Left alone again.
inside edge into the pad. Cummins begins to appeal, before bailing out of the stroke. Full and moving back in, a thick edge.
a short delivery down leg, 140 kph, flies over the shoulder of Amla.
well bowled. Back of a length outside off, the ball shapes away late, Amla leaves watchfully.
on a length outside off, 143 kph, the ball is moving away, Amla plays it towards point. Just getting enough away movement.
very quiet after the break, full outside off, a solid defensive block again.
nice and full outside off, 90 kph. Elgar comes right over the ball to smother any spin
nice and full, another defensive block.
short and wide, slow turn. Soooo much time for Elgar to go back and let that one go.
extra bounce, 89 kph, flight outside off, Elgar takes one hand off the bat as he looks to defend. Splices away towards silly point, but no one there.
very tidy lines, 95 kph, blocked.
just popped over mid-on for a couple. Some flight around off, Elgar gets underneath the length and chips the ball over
very good lines, full outside off, not much movement. Amla is forward, looking to defend, off the outside half.
drifts on the pads this time, 137 kph, nudged off the inside edge down to fine leg
full delivery outside off, the ball pitches and moves away to beat the edge.
another beauty! Two in a row. Full on a fourth-stump channel. Elgar is beaten in the outside edge as he brings his bat down. He'll take that, instead of an edge.
full and wide outside off, 142 kph, left alone
good end, full and straight, defended into the off side
flat outside off, the ball turning in. Amla lifts his hands to let that one go.
shortish outside off, turning in, nudged to short leg
flat outside off, punched back to the bowler.
slow outside off, nudged into the leg side.
picks the gap and will get four. It's shorter and wider. Amla rocks back and scythes a cut into the gap at cover
shortish outside off, worked away towards midwicket, 91 kph
a shortish delivery down leg, 141 kph, nudged down towards the keeper's right. Amla sends Elgar back.
full around middle and leg, 144 kph, pushed to mid-off. No fluency in Elgar's innings, but that's his way.
144 kph, full and wide, the ball moving away. Elgar looks to drive, but the bat hits the ground and the ball misses the edge.
good length down leg, 138 kph, defended
good length down leg, blocked again.
full delivery outside off, Elgar withdraws his bat but the ball hits the bat first
too full outside off, Amla leans into a drive and finds a couple through cover.
full delivery outside off, 133 kph, the ball moving in, left alone.
full and moving back in, the ball coming back in, 133 kph, defended to mid-on
a good length delivery outside off, 134 kph, left alone
excellent lines, 133 kph, just outside off, Amla lets that one go.
full outside off, 137 kph, the ball coming back in, skewed away towards midwicket
full and straight, Elgar is right behind the line to defend. Will he get some reverse swing?
full and straight, 138 kph, pushed to mid-on
on a length around off, 140 kph, the ball is starting to move back in, defended to cover
ooh yes, the ball is now moving back in! Full on middle and leg, very awkwardly defended.
full and wide, left alone, 137 kph
another maiden, 137 kph, full on off, blocked to mid-off
132 kph, prodigious reverse swing! A full delivery is moving back in, Amla is beaten on the inside edge, struck on the pad.
a full delivery outside off, 134 kph, the ball moves away and beats the bat.
full and wide outside off, 134 kph, left alone. Elgar gritting it out.
135 kph, a full delivery around off, comes back in, pushed to cover
finds some runs. Full and wide outside off, pushed away towards mid-off, Warner dives to his left but the ball goes through. He stops the four with a good chase
good length outside off, 136 kph, played into the off side
back of a length around middle, 143 kph, a thick inside edge towards square leg for one.
the yorker, the one that's moving. Who else thinks that would have got a No. 11 out? Full on middle and leg, defended towards gully
142 kph, full outside off, driven towards wide mid-off for a run. Well-judged single.
that's sensational! All reverse. The ball pitches and moves back in, Elgar wanted to leave but he somehow defends. That would have definitely got a No. 11
full and straight, more reverse swing. Elgar is behind the line, awkwardly but ably.
too wide this time, full and wide, left alone.

136 kph. Amla reviews immediately. Big inside edge. That's what Amla told Smith. Was it given out on the appeal? A loud, vociferous appeal from Hazlewood. The ball is full and wide, comes back in with the reverse. A thick inside edge into the pad. The crowd goes wild.
full outside off, moving in, 131 kph, worked to midwicket. REVERSE SWING in all its glory.
full outside off, 132 kph, this one holds its line, terrific bowling from Hazlewood. Left alone. Excellent from Amla too
too straight from Hazlewood, clipped away through backward square leg for a couple.

edged, but wide of Smith at second slip. Full outside off, the ball holds its line, a thick outside edge towards the slip fielder, who half-stops it. Smith seems to have hurt a finger on his right hand. It landed well short.
130 kph, good length around off, tapped towards slip.
141 kph, down leg, nudged to midwicket
a full wide delivery elicits a drive. 143 kph, driven to short cover. Starc won't mind that shot at all.
short delivery around off, 140 kph, off the leading edge into the off side.
shortish delivery outside off, some inward movement, punched away to cover
shortish and wide outside off, another leave, 143 kph.
short on middle, worked away in front of square, towards midwicket for one.
full and moving in, nudged down to fine leg
full outside off, 132 kph, the ball pitches and moves away. Well left this time.
full and moving back in this time. Awesome bowling. Too much swing though, The ball beats Elgar on the inside edge, hits him on the pad, but sliding down leg.
full outside off, left alone
full around off, 132 kph, defended back
134 kph, full outside off, the ball comes back in, outside-halved away to point.
full and into the pads. Hurriedly flicked to square leg
expansive drive on the up, away from the body. It's a soft ball, barely takes off after beating the infield. Amla ran his hands through this outside off to get it past mid-off
inswinging yorker at middle stump is jammed out in a hurry. That bat's parallel to the floor when he finishes this. Whew.
short and wide outside off, left alone
beats the outside edge! Oh man. Elgar looking for the one that comes in, pushing nervously at it with the stumps exposed. It lifts off the surface and goes past the outside edge
length on the pads, glanced to fine leg
short of a length and swung into the hips. Dabs it to fine leg
full outswinger, wide outside off. Left alone
full outswinger outside off, left alone
inswinger now hooping in sharply from a good length. Looks to flick but can't get it past the keeper
full and in at leg stump. Blocked on the front foot
another inswinger, wide of the crease. Length ball on leg and he shuffles and clips to fine leg
good length and into the pads. Stands tall, nudges with soft hands to square leg's right to bring up his fifty. A solid, gutsy knock from The Hash
overpitched, wide outswinger outside off. Left alone
short of a length in the corridor, nudged to gully on the bounce
good length, late inswing at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length and straight through in the corridor. Left alone
length and swinging in from outside off. Left alone
short of a length and cutting in at off stump. Leaps to punch to extra cover
good length on middle stump, dabbed to square leg's right with soft hands
jabs and is beaten. Loose from Elgar. It's a length ball angled across off stump
full and just outside off. Left alone
good length and just outside off. Defended into the slip cordon off the outside half
short of a length and swung away outside off. Left alone
full and very wide outswinger. Left alone
good length and some shape away outside off. Left alone
full and wide outside off, left alone
short ball outside off, takes it on with a hook. Beaten. He was swiping well under that
back of a length outside off, left alone
short and very wide outside off. Early as he looks to cut. It rolls out to mid-off

outside edge through the slips! That's fifty for Elgar, and there isn't a better representation of his innings than that. Full awayswinger outside off, chases it with his hands and it flies between second slip and gully
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length and in at leg stump. Flicked to fine leg off the hips
back of a length and pushed down leg side. Can't get bat on the flick
short ball pitches outside leg and goes further down. Left alone

ball of the match! Elgar has done ridiculously well not to get out to this. Full ball starts outside off and swings back in fast. Suddenly it's a yorker headed for middle stump. Somehow gets bat on this without falling over. Plumb in front otherwise
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
bouncer outside off, left alone
good length and a hint of shape into off stump. He drops it in front of mid-off with soft hands and Amla calls through for a very risky single. He makes it, albeit with a struggle
back of a length just outside off, dabbed to gully with soft hands
full and swinging away from him. He pokes at it with an open face, almost reluctantly. Gets it to run wide of backward point
short of a length outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length, some swing away from the corridor. Left alone
good length at off stump and it spits up at him as he looks to defend on the front foot. Rams the inside shoulder of the bat and squeezes into the leg side
beaten as he looks for yet another expansive drive against Marsh. Overpitched and moving away late outside off, the feet didn't bring him close to the ball
good length with shape away. Left alone
good length swinging away outside off, left alone
full on leg stump, flicked straight to square leg
good length and late movement away from off stump. Defended off the outside half
good length, hoops away outside off. Left alone
full and wide, left alone
full and wide outside off, withdraws from the shot after shaping to drive
yorker outside off, squeezed into the off side
full outside off, left alone
very full, aimed at the toes but just outside off, Elgar gets the bottom of the bat down and defends
full and at the stumps, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, dabbed through point off the back foot
full and wide outside off, he has a nibble and is beaten
short of a length on off, defended off the back foot
full and wide outside off, leans in and drives to cover
full and at the stumps. Hurriedly keeps it out with a defensive
beats the bat after shaping to Amla. It rises on him too as he looks to play
onto the stumps and he flicks to deep square leg
draws him forward and he blocks solidly
pushed across off stump and he lets it go
full outside off with some movement in. Left alone
full and swinging away, very wide. Left alone
full outside off, left alone
nice length, fuller than good. 137 kph, around off, a thick outside edge down to gully
on the pads, flicked away through midwicket for a couple. A dangerous shot with the ball reversing, but he's been there awhile.

gone through Amla! A full delivery outside off, the ball has been reversing and this one does too! If Amla can't lay bat on it, it's going to be a tough time for the rest of South Africa. The point of release is wide of the crease, it looks destined for middle from that angle, but the ball straightens ever so late, beats the outside edge and uproots off stump! What a delivery. Too good even for Amla.
strays down leg, 141 kph, de Villiers misses a flick.
full and straight, a full-faced drive to mid-on. Superb start for Australia
beaten on the outside edge! A full delivery outside off, the ball pitches and moves away like an offbreak.
a full delivery outside off, defended away. Top hand is soft on the bat handle.
more away movement. Full outside off, moving away, defended into the off side.
full delivery around off, defended
full outside off, a thick outside edge towards gully.

edged and gone! That was too good. This has been a terrific spell of reverse swing bowling. A full delivery outside off, Elgar prods, the ball moves away like an offbreak, takes the outside edge and goes through to Paine. A very gritty 57, but Australia are right back in this one.
driven through cover. And the crowd goes wild. Full and wide, AB leans into a drive, finds a big gap.
a fullish delivery outside off, tapped away towards gully. The ball goes through Khawaja for a run, 143 kph. Don't think Starc will mind that, he's had success against Faf already this series.
walks across slightly and nudges the ball to square leg
full and wide outside off, left alone.
full outside off, driven to mid-on, 143 kph
goes short, down leg, not well directed. Easily negotiated.
back of a length outside off, 134 kph, defended back from the crease
132 kph, back of a length on off, the ball wobbles past the inside edge and hits AB on the body via the inside edge.
on middle and leg, goes past AB's inside edge and hits him on the body again.
full outside off, moving back in, AB lifts his hands and lets that one go
good leave. It's the other one, the ball that moves away after pitching. Left alone
back of a length outside off, 133 kph, pushed to cover from the back foot. A maiden.
short outside off, Faf looks to pull but the ball goes past. Trying to be positive, not a bad move at all.
a full delivery outside off, defended to mid-off
swinging in, full and straight, clipped to square leg. Loud call of yes.
a tad short, AB picks the length yesterday, stays back and swivel-pulls behind square for four. Shot.
a full delivery outside off, defended back to the bowler. Right behind the line.
around middle and off, nudged towards square leg. Six off the over.
good length outside off, AB opens the bat face and plays to slip, as if an afterthought
a more confident, positive leave outside off
can't leave this, full, swinging back in, around off, defended
131 kph, on the pads, worked away behind square for a run.
full and moving back in quite a bit, defended to mid-on
well left, goes wide of the crease, back of a length outside off, left alone
lovely shot, good stop too. Back of a length outside off, 136 kph, driven away to the left of cover. Bancroft dives away.
full and moving away, no need to play at that. Hit to point.
good length around off, AB is right behind the line
full delivery outside off, moving away again, but solidly blocked
excellent over, very well played too. Full outside off, the ball moving away. No need to play, he doesn't.
a tad wide, Faf sees an opportunity to score and punches in front of point for a couple.
full delivery outside off, 135 kph, defended
back of a length, seaming back in, pushed to cover
short delivery outside off, it's an opportunity. De Villiers carves the ball past gully for four. Interesting tactic because it can open avenues to score.
overpitched outside off, driven away to mid-off
139 kph, movement. Hits AB on the pad, but sliding down, says the umpire. AB late on a flick.
a full delivery outside off, pitching and moving away, defended to point
another full delivery outside off, Faf brings the bat down late to defend
a full delivery around off, 141 kph, popped off the inside half to square leg

Smith wants to review. That's a snorter of a bouncer from Cummins, superbly directed, right at the badge. He takes his eyes off the ball, the ball hits AB on the forearm, then the shoulder, then the helmet, then lobs to Smith at second slip. Australia think there is glove, but the ball is nowhere near the glove. So a wasted review, but it's the second best delivery of the session, after the Amla wicket one.
a good length delivery outside off, 143 kph, moving away, right behind the line to defend
lovely bowling. AB will glad the over is done, gets a moment to regather his thoughts. A back of a length delivery outside off, the ball keeps moving away and beats the bat.
short and wide outside off, Faf sees width and carves a cut to the cover point boundary. Lovely hit, can't be leaving those deliveries.
full and straight, moving back in, nudged to midwicket

plumb in front! That looked out. It's that reverse again. But Faf asks for the review. It's much fuller than the previous ones, it finds a gap between bat and pad, hits Faf on the back pad in front of leg. Wonder if he was taken aback by how much movement Marsh got. Three reds on HawkEye, SA now in a bit of trouble
a length delivery outside off, blocked into the off side
a good leave. Full and wide outside off, left alone
full and straight, again attacking the pads, pushed to mid-on
a full delivery outside off, right behind the line is AB
141 kph, de Villiers did not read that, but he is a classy-enough batsman to get bat on that. Full, swinging back in very late. A thick inside edge to square leg
excellent change in length, short outside off, gets underneath
full and wide outside off, the ball moving away, defended
on a length on off, clipped to midwicket
a short delivery drifts down leg, helped along down to fine leg for one.
a full delivery outside off, AB is behind the line to block
good length outside off, carved away to deep point for one
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket

gone! De Bruyn now given out lbw. And he does not review. SA are now six down. A full delivery seams back in, de Bruyn misses a drive, struck on the pad in front of middle. The ball moves back in like an offbreak. Umpire Dharmasena says that's out. Umpire's call, just clipping the side of leg stump.
a full delivery outside off, jammed back.
a full delivery outside off, driven to mid-off.
full and wide, 140 kph, the ball moving away, left alone.
full and wide, the ball moving away. A thick outside edge races away in the gap at gully. SA need all these runs and a lot, lot more.
full around off, right behind the line is AB
smashed through midwicket. Cummins drops short, on off. He picks the length early and goes boom! In the gap at midwicket, rolls his wrists over the ball.
a lovely drive through cover for two more. Full and wide, 140 kph, outside off, driven through cover for two.
another stellar shot by a top batsman. Full on middle, drilled through mid-on for four. Full face of the bat.
overpitched and wide outside off, caressed to cover from the crease
full outside off, 139 kph, behind the line is de Kock. SA need another inspiring contribution from him
full outside off, hit in front of deep point for one.
back of a length around middle, clipped to square leg
comes back in again, 132 kph, hits de Villiers on the pad but well down leg
back of a length outside off, defended into the off side.
good length and swung in at middle stump. Pushed uppishly to mid-on off the front foot
short of a length outside off, sliced to deep point on the up
good length and pushed wide across off stump, left alone
full and hooping away from middle stump. Driven across the angle to mid-on
bouncer angled across off stump, left alone
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square leg's right and it's deft enough for him to come back for the second
good length outside off, punched to sweeper's left off the front foot
length ball angled into the hips and he pokes it past Paine off the glove
full outside off, driven on the front foot
overpitched outside off stump, neatly driven to mid-off on the front foot
good length just outside off, nicely driven on the up past the non-striker. Mid-off dives to his left to stop
short and wide outside off and he spanks it off the middle, not too far to deep point's right
shot. But straight to mid-on. This swings in a long way at leg stump and he drives with full balance and the full face offered
overpitched outside off, driven to sweeper's right
good length with late swing away from the corridor. Defended with soft hands
back of a length just outside off, steered to deep point off the back foot
overpitched outside off, hint of swing in. But it's another well-timed drive from QDK. Straight to extra cover
he's middling them every time. Full on off stump and it's driven straight to mid-off
full and pushed wide outside off. Sliced to backward point off the front foot
full outside off, goes well forward and Smith at slip thinks he's looking to sweep. He takes a step into the leg side and finds out that AB has, in fact, brought out the reverse sweep
short of a length outside off, backs away and cuts to point
good length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, defended into the covers
yorker speared in at leg stump. Gets the front leg out of the way and keeps this out
another yorker at leg stump. Closes the face on this and gets it between his legs. Steals a single from Paine
full outswinger outside off, drives solidly on the up, straight to short extra cover
slices it past gully. A low full toss, very wide outside off. He reaches out and ends up steering this, one-handed and aerially, to the backward point boundary
