fifty for ABD. Full control. Low full toss comes in at the stumps this time and he leans in to whip this through midwicket
inside edge and into the body as he looks to squeeze one through cover. It's a full ball outside off
struck on the pad as he pushes onto the back foot. But this slider has come in from middle stump
back of a length and turning away a touch from off stump. Leading edge as he looks to flick

what a ball, Lyon! Superb! QDK can't do anything about this. The perfect pace, the perfect amount of flight and the perfect spot on the pitch as this drifts in and draws him forward. He's shown half of off stump and the ball finds it after spinning past the outside edge
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length and spinning in sharply from middle stump. Cops it on the thigh
good length on leg stump. Clipped to square leg off the back foot
full and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
back of a length and swinging away late. Left alone
full outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
yorker on off stump. Jams it pitch side into the leg side. Calls no, then yes, very late and then says no again. Sloppy but safe in the end
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
stunning placement. It's full on off stump, he gets down very early and watches it closely before swatting it to the square leg boundary
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
length outside off, not to the pitch as he drives this to mid-off. Got in a tangle
short of a length and spinning into and bouncing at the mid-riff. Cops it on the pad as he looks to glance
back of a length and shaping away outside off. Defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, left alone
attempted yorker goes wrong. It's a full toss speared into his legs and he tickles it fine
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
oh yes! Lovely! Smith brings the field in on the off side, so AB arches backwards against this short of a length ball, creates room for himself, and slices from under it to get it over gully
short of a length on middle stump, allows it to come on and drops it behind square on the leg side
good length outside off, left alone
good length ball comes in late in the corridor. He covers the off stump and leaves. This came very close to the stumps
short of a length outside off, mistimed punch off the back foot. Rolls out to mid-off and he decides late on the single
good length and swinging in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, pushed to gully off the back foot
short of a length outside off, pushed to gully off the back foot
short and wide outside off, slapped straight to sweeper point
full outside off and late movement away as he pushes with hard hands in front of his body. Angled bat so he gets a thick outside edge and this runs between gully and point
good length outside off, left alone
beaten on the inside edge. Full and angled in at off stump. He's expecting it to swing away but ti doesn't
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover
good length on leg stump, nudged wide of mid-on with the bottom hand off the bat
full outside off, steered to gully off the outside half
swings in from off stump and hits him on the thigh as he looks to shovel this into the leg side with no feet movement
full inswinger on leg stump, clipped straight to short midwicket
swings through and gets it over point. Starc baits him with a full and wide one. Philander makes no effort at finesse - slashes with no feet movement and gets it over
leans in this time. Length ball angled across off and he drives on the up to get it wide of deep point
full inswinger into the pads. Clipped to deep square's left
full outside off, nicely driven to mid-off
short ball angled leg side, he ducks under it
beats Philander the way Philander beats everyone else. Length ball, in the corridor, zipping away marginally off the pitch and sneaking past the outside edge
full on off stump, pushed uppishly through cover off the front foot

outside edge but he's gone at this with soft hands. It lands short of where third slip would've been. There is no third slip. It's four. Another beauty from Hazlewood, moving away off the surface after drawing him forward
good length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
back of a length and spitting up at on off stump line. Defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
beaten. Angles in, climbs up after strengthening and he won't connect on the back foot defence
short of a length wide outside off, left alone
bouncer dropped too short, he ducks under it
good length on middle stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
nicely bowled, but he won't bite. Short ball just outside off. He leaves
short of a length on middle stump, gets on top of the bounce and drops it into the leg side with soft hands
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump, nudged to mid-on off the front foot
good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on leg stump, tapped into the leg side from the crease
full on leg stump, offers the full face and taps this to mid-on off the front foot
he's away immediately. This is a leg-stump half-volley that AB flicks to long leg
slants it full but way outside off, Philander doesn't bother looking at that
angles a full delivery outside off, Philander lets it go
uppish drive that lands on the bounce to extra cover. This may have held up just a touch. Philander committed to the stroke quite early
right to the pitch of this half-volley as he drives to mid-off
gets onto his toes and tucks this gently into the leg side as they scamper a single
that's a screamer to the cover boundary. Gentle and overpitched outside off, Philander leant into it and caressed it nicely. Head right over the ball
shortens his length and lands this around off, Philander inside edges a defensive stroke onto the pad.
floats this wide, inviting Philander to have a slash but he lets it go
angles a full delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, Philander shows the full face of the bat as he defends to mid-off
hops back into the crease and defends back this short of length delivery

draws the edge but this doesn't carry to the keeper, who dives full length to his right. Deflects off Mitch Marsh's hand at first slip to the third man boundary. Handy runs that Philander will take however they come.
short of length delivery angling away, left alone
full outside off, left alone again
touch ahead of length and angling across, AB leaves
short of length delivery angling away, AB shapes to cut but decides against it in the end. Watched through to Tim Paine
heart-in-the-mouth moment for AB briefly. This is a full toss which he looks to hit over mid-off, fortunately didn't hit it well enough to carry. On the bounce to Warner.
hint of width, AB flays this on the up to deep point. Will keep strike
takes off from a spot at length outside off, AB leaves and this bursts through Paine's hand to the boundary. Four byes. This got to Paine quicker than he thought. Should've been gathered
tucks this towards midwicket for a quick single
beautiful bowling. Full on off, this tails away just a touch to miss Philander's tentative poke
angles into middle and leg, Philader prods and gets a thick inside edge that races past square leg
excellent leave. Full delivery that jags back in off the seam from fourth stump.
shows the full face of the bat to play a dead-defense
hits the deck hard at length on middle, AB hops back and defends
whipped off his hip to deep square leg
pacy length ball that snakes back in to hit Philander on the thigh pad and onto the box. Ouch, that will pain.
beats the inside edge on the drive. Philander lured to play that through cover but played down the wrong line, lost his shape.

this is gorgeous! You'd pay good money to watch a cover drive like that. Right to the pitch of the ball, nice-high elbow as he presses forward to essay a delightful drive. This was asking to be hit and he did
slants a short of length ball across, left alone.
gets half a stride in forward to defend this length ball on off
short on middle, AB is in position as he pulls this all along the ground to deep square leg
angling into the pads, hits Philander on the thigh pad as he looks to nudge this gently
right back into the crease as he bunts this into the off side. Could've so easily chopped on
angling into the pads, misses the flick.
hint of width on offer outside off but Philander is happy to leave
gets half forward and defends
length ball that rushes onto AB as he defends back
short ball angling away, AB thought of the pull but let it go at the last moment
hops back and turns this gently into the leg side as they jog the single
off-cutter at length on middle and off, Philander is right behind the line in defence
excellent short ball angling away, Vern shows good technique in dropping his wrists and swaying out of the way
gets a good stride forward and defends this length ball into the off side
text book forward defense to a full delivery angling in from wide of the crease
angles in a full ball on middle, AB defends into the leg side
dispatched with disdain. Misses his length, turns into a middle-and-leg-stump half-volley which he flicks imperiously wide of mid-on. Vintage AB, superb balance. Delightful wrist work
right behind the line as he defends

plays this really, really late. Length outside off, AB takes a step across towards off stump, gets right on top of the bounce and pats it very delicately into the gap between slip and gully. So, so calculative, so very effective.
lunges forward and turns this back with the spin to Lyon
drifts away but Philander lunges forward and defends to the leg side with soft hands
right on top of the bounce as he wrists this behind square on the leg side
tossed up on middle and leg, worked with the spin to short midwicket
works this with the spin to deep square leg. Nice roll of the wrists
fired full outside off, Philander deadbats
oh ho-ho-ho. AB disdainfully pulls that off the frontfoot to the midwicket fence. Picking the length early was the key and he latched onto it in a jiffy. AB marches into the 90s
half-volley on the pads, flicked deliciously to deep midwicket. There was two on that, but he decides against it this time. Influenced by the run-out in the previous Test, perhaps?
skiddy bouncer on middle, Philander ducks under it
jabs at this full delivery, manages to squirt this behind point. Down towards the small boundary, they come back for the second
thick edge, but does well to take his bottom hand off the grip, lands short of second slip.
shapes to play an on-drive, toe-ends it to short mid-on.
bounce from the rough, spins back in to hit AB on the inside thigh as he looks to turn this to the leg side
right on top of the bounce as he wrists this towards square leg
sharp turn but from way outside off, Philander waits for the turn and then tucks this to square leg
drifts away across the batsman, AB drives firmly but straight to cover
too short, AB makes room and cuts to Starc at deep point
short, sitting up nicely and he pulls this to deep square leg
short ball but way over Philander's head, avoided easily
plays outside the line of this delivery that angles in to hit him high on the thigh pad.

big appeal again. Too much bounce? Smith ponders a review and decides against it. Philander plays all around this length ball angling in and is hit on top of the knee roll. This would've gone over?. Hawkeye suggests it would've clipped, so would've been umpire's call at best. So Australia wouldn't have lost a review even had they taken one.
gets half-forward and jabs this length ball into the off side
shows the full face of the bat in defence of this length ball on the stumps
drives to get a thick inside edge down to deep midwicket
stretches forward and defends this tossed up delivery that drifts in a long way
right on top of the bounce as he turns this wide of short leg
not much turn, this just drifts away, AB lunges forward, covers the line and blocks
right to the pitch of the ball as he defends this tossed up delivery on middle
goes back and across as he tucks this straight into the short leg fielder on the bounce
shapes to play an expansive drive but he's deceived in flight, ends up pushing hard to mid-off
dropped at short leg by Bancroft. This came off the splice of the bat as he looked to turn this gently. He did well to move to his left but couldn't get low enough.
gets half a stride in as he squirts this length ball into the off side

this time, Bancroft makes no mistake at short leg. Cummins hits the deck hard, gets good bounce. Philander plays in front of the body as he's caught on the crease, came off the splice again but lobbed at a comfortable height. Right at the stroke of the drinks interval
full on off, he squirts this push into the off side to get off the mark

arches back and helps this short ball over the slips. What a way to bring up a hundred, his 22nd in Tests and his first since January, 2015. This is his first century in 13 Tests and he realises the value of it. Super, super knock
shapes to pull but gets out of the way in the end. Paine does well to leap like a goalkeeper and stop that.
goes across and shows the full face of the bat in defence
bounce from the rough but this is too short. It just shoots up to beat the batsman and keeper, four byes.
turns this with the spin to short midwicket
steps out to whip this away but this lobs off the pad to short leg
makes room and punches this length ball into the cover region
lunges forward to turn this past midwicket but the ball beats the inside edge to lob off the pad towards the bowler

brain freeze from Maharaj, has it cost him? AB can't believe what he's just seen. This was nicely tossed up by Lyon, Maharaj is lured into this big, big heave with the spin. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball so didn't get the timing and power he would've liked. This would have still carried all the way if not for Khawaja's awareness. He kept his eyes on the ball, but may have miscalculated where the ropes were. As he caught the ball, his backfoot was in contact with the turf behind the ropes just before he lobbed the ball back up to catch it inside the field of play. Let-off technically. Maharaj and SA will heave a sigh of relief
squirts this drive to deep point. AB refuses the single
tries to run it down but misses
hops back and punches this length delivery into the gap at deep extra cover, Mitch Marsh comes around to stop that
walks across the stumps and whips this length ball into the gap at deep midwicket. Excellent running
disdainfully pulled in front of square to clear deep midwicket. Took a step outside off, but AB created the length by going deep back into the crease and put this away magically.
right behind the line of this length ball in defense
punched into the gap at cover, AB back on strike. Easily done
slow turn from leg stump, tucked behind square for an easy single
looks to whip this behind but is beaten by the turn
on the shorter side, he goes back and across and turns this into the leg side
lunges forward and defends to the leg side with soft hands

another heave and he's nailed this. Saw the flight and couldn't hold back as he stepped out and launched this over wide long-on. Timed this sensationally, onto the roof. The ball bounces back into the stands.
squeezes this drive to cover
lovely balance as he flicks this leg-stump half-volley to deep midwicket, refuses the single
right on top of the bounce as he bunts this short of length delivery to the bowler
crunching cover drive, but they don't take the run again. Down to sweeper cover
picked away towards Lyon, who dives around to stop that full-blooded flick at deep midwicket
too much width outside off, he runs it down to third man
short on middle, he moves to the leg side to make some room and gives this a proper whack. Walloped to the deep point fence
turns this to short fine, refuses the run though
lunges forward and turns this wide of midwicket
cut away but can't pick the gap, straight to backward point
back and across as he turns this shortish delivery to square leg

massive shout for lbw as AB is struck on the pad attempting a reverse paddle. Given not out, Australia review immediately. Was it turning too much? Would it have missed leg? Plenty of questions. This ball was nicely tossed up but lands on middle and leg, misses AB's paddle and hits him just below the knee roll. Hang on, there's a very very small spike, possibly off the glove. So they didn't even look at ball tracking. Onfield decision of not out stays. Australia have exhausted their reviews
angles a short ball into the stumps from around the wicket, Maharaj looks to duck but ends up having a swipe at it, beaten.
delightful off-drive. This was floated full, Maharaj was quick to pounce on it. Intended to bowl a yorker, turned out to be a half-volley
nails this short ball that he fetches from outside off to the deep midwicket fence. Enterprising batting that looks really fun when it comes off.
slashed away over point. Picked the bones out of this. The half-century stand is up too! Even AB enjoyed that cut.
right into the blockhole on leg stump, kept out by Maharaj somehow. He was off balance
another rip-roaring yorker on the stumps, this time from around the wicket. Maharaj just about manages to get his bat down in time to keep that out
floats this full on off stump, defended from the crease
right besides the line of this length ball as he defends.
scorcher of a drive but an excellent stop by Bancroft at cover
that's the end of Maharaj's cameo. Shapes to pull but this wasn't as short as he expected. Through with the swing as the ball crashed into the bails.
shows the full face of the bat and defends this full-length delivery
somehow manages to avoid this short ball as he ducks under it
dabs this incoming length delivery into the off side
yorker-length delivery honing in towards the off stump, dug out by AB
slashes this slightly full delivery outside off to deep point
reaches out and cuts this short delivery to deep point, refuses the single
full but down leg, AB looks swing this behind square but misses
another full ball that is deliberately bowled down leg, AB swings and misses.
shapes to drive and gets a thick inside edge that squirts away past midwicket. Useful runs
solid thump down the ground but straight to mid-off
lobs off the shoulder to gully. Rip roaring bouncer this from Hazlewood. Ngidi doesn't show any pain but this must hurt. Smack into the right shoulder as he looked to duck under that

shapes to help this down leg but somehow just gets some glove on it, wasn't far from Paine but AB decides to scamper the run. The throw is fired at the bowler's end where Warner fails to gather this cleanly and whip the bails off, because he was on the move.
surely deliberate again? Fires this full and way down leg. AB can't do anything about it, Paine half-stops it. They scamper a bye. Should've been called wide, me thinks
right behind the line of this full delivery as he defends. Huge round of applause from the crowd
drilled over the bowler's head, Warner comes around and slides in a long-off before firing a throw. AB was willing Lungi on to get back and he just about manages to.
backs away and carves this into the cover boundary. Sensational. Picked his spot to perfection. Opened up the off side, cleared the frontfoot and whacked it away
short outside of, AB wanted to ramp this over slip but couldn't

squirts this into the cover region and chances a second. Smith is superb to run in from deep cover, pick the ball up and fire a direct hit at the bowler's end. Ngidi had no chance. That's the end of that. AB walks off to a huge round of applause, South Africa have a big lead. He walks off unbeaten on 126. What a session of Test cricket we've had. That's lunch on day three
he launches his spell with a full awayswinger outside off, ignored in the channel
good length, pitches on a fourth-stump line and nibbles away outside off again, Bancroft does not bite
Philander shifts his line wider, bends away outside off, no shot again
pitched up and largely holds its line outside off, Bancroft does not bother with it again
full and attacking off stump now, Bancroft has to play at this. He inches forward, keeps the head over the ball, and defends it to the covers
Philander straightens his line and floats it too full, Bancroft drives it gently in the gap between mid-on and midwicket
red-hot stuff, he starts off with a bouncer on leg stump, aimed for the head, Warner ducks out of the way of harm
back of a length and skidding into the thigh, tucks up the opener for room, deflected to the leg side
back of a length and fizzing down leg at 140ks, Warner is a touch late onto his leg glance. Beaten
Radaba cranks it up to 142ks, pitches just outside leg and seams sharply to hit the back thigh

this is even better from Rabada. Ngidi enjoyed it more. This is like a fizzing offbreak. 143ks, starts outside off and cunningly swerves away wide outside off towards first slip. De Kock misjudges it but somehow gathers the ball
cracking over first-up from Rabada. Back of a length, pitches on leg or just outside leg, cuts away and bounces just over middle stump
Philander at the other end keeps plugging away outside off, no shot
starts way too wide outside off and nips away, Bancroft leaves confidently again. You've got to bring it closer to off and get it to bend away
floated full and outside off, Bancroft is quite happy to let these go
Philander attacks off stump with a full ball, nips away, squares up Bancroft. He pokes an outside edge to backward point
back of a length and easily picked off the pads to the left of square-ish long leg
back of a length and outside off, Bancroft shoulders arms again
pace like fire - 151ks. Really full on middle, driven back, Rabada throws himself to his left to stop the ball
lifter, angling away outside off, just 145ks, Warner rocks his head out of the way
back of a length and zinging away outside off, 149ks, Warner leaves it
Warner gets off the mark after facing 10 balls from Rabada. This is a friendly offering on the hips, tickled away fine on the leg side for four
full and angling across off, beats the outside edge
Warner jabs this short ball to cover and yells 'wait on'
very full on middle, forward and driven up to mid-on
very full on off, defended
full on middle, presses forward and works it to short midwicket
full and nibbling away outside off, left alone
back of a length and encouraging carry through to the keeper as Bancroft leaves it
Bancroft continues to show good awareness of his off stump and lets another one go outside off
pretty full and angling away outside off, Warner plays outside the line and squirts an inside edge onto the pad. Did Rabada mock Warner there? He yells 'C'mon'. Cool off, Rabada
bouncer, flies over Warner's head, flies over a leaping de Kock
back of a length, starts outside off, snakes back in, but does not threaten off. Left alone
back of a length, 144ks, bounces in the channel, Bancroft thought about having a jab at it before pulling his bat inside the line
back of a length and zips back in from outside off, Bancroft is beaten for pace and cops a blow on the midriff. He doesn't flinch. Look at the red mark on his shirt
Bancroft now finds some breathing space with a glance to fine leg

good length and angling away outside off, Warner drags himself forward. He gets closer to the pitch and fluently drives it to mid-off, where Faf du Plessis lets the ball through his legs. Rabada isn't pleased one bit
full and nips away outside off, left alone
pitched further up and Philander brings this one back in at off stump, beats the inside edge and hits him high on the thigh. The lbw appeal is shot down - height seems to be an issue
this is the outswinger, Bancroft reads it and lets it go
pitched up at off stump, opens the face and deftly dabs through the gap at point
Philander's first ball to Warner in the second innings: pitched up on off, 'wait on' is the cry from Warner as he push-drives to mid-off off the front foot
really full on middle, Warner protects his castle and defends it
chest-hunting short ball on middle, Bancroft rides the bounce and fends it off past the right of short leg for three
really full on middle, shapes away late, an outside edge streaks away past the right of backward point. Fortunate edge and four for Warner
tickled off the pads through backward square leg for a double. Warner tears back for the second. Given as leg byes
Warner hangs back, rides the bounce of this shortish ball on middle. Drops it to the leg side and scampers through for a sharp single
back of a length and bounces outside off, nothing doing from Bancroft
full and outside off, Bancroft deploys a solid stride and drives to mid-off, where the fielder fumbles and concedes a single
good length and on off, Bancroft brings his bat down in line and blocks to cover
fuller than a good length and nibbles away outside off, Bancroft stretches out and finds the fielder in the infield with his textbook-style cover drive
full and curves back in, he plays around his front pad, head falls over, prodded to midwicket
nice and full outside off, Bancroft isn't tempted yet
good length, blocked on off stump
back of a length and put wide outside off, left alone, and that rounds out a maiden
speared full on middle, 144ks, Warner yells 'wait on' as he taps it straight to cover

...and Rabada wins the intense battle with a ripper that storms through the gate. Rabada hits that in-between length - neither driveable nor pullable - and gets the ball to move back in against the angle from outside off. He slices through the defences of the opener and tilts the off stump back. No shoulder brushes, no contact. More sedate celebrations from Rabada, if one could call that. He just screams in the face of the defeated Warner, but then again it's likely to attract unwanted attention. Cool off, Rabada
full and angling across off, prodded to midwicket
pitched up and wide outside off - wider than a set of stumps - Khawaja simply reaches out for the ball with his hands and scoops a drive through cover-point
full and angling away, seaming away close to off. So Khawaja pokes and is beaten on the outside edge
full and wide outside off, Khawaja goes after it and slices a drive through point for his second boundary
full and outside off, stretches forward and drives to mid-off
back of a length on top of off, defended back to the bowler
very full and straight, forward and pushed down to mid-on
Philander shortens his length and shifts his line wider outside off, left alone
full and angling into a front-foot push to cover
126ks legbreak, screams past the outside edge. Good length, angling in, then sharply moving past the outside edge
half-volley on middle and leg, Khawaja flicks it straight to square leg
full and angling away outside off, Khawaja loosens his grip and dabs it with soft hands to the cordon
lifter on leg stump, Khawaja ducks out of the way
back of a length and bouncing just outside off, Khawaja lets it go
pitched up on off, Khawaja has a short stride as he pushes it back to the bowler
back of a length and bounces over off stump, tight, tight leave from Khawaja
drifts, dips, and turns, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Poked to the covers
slides in quicker on middle, blocked
shorter and spins away outside off, chopped to backward point, where there's another fumble
Maharaj goes up for an lbw appeal. Not given by umpire Dharmasena. This was pushed through flatter and quicker, Bancroft plays back and smashes and inside edge onto the pad
straight ball on middle, eased down the ground
slower through the air on off, forward and smothered. And that's drinks
turns and bounces outside off, bursts past the top edge
lured into the drive, but didn't get to the pitch. Drawn forward, he has a waft and is beaten
short of length on middle and leg, Bancroft is hustled for pace but manages to work this towards square leg
angles a length ball across Khawaja, who shoulders arms
extra bounce from length on off stump, Khawaja takes his bottom hand off the grip as he defends
shapes to drive to this delivery that swerves back in, but he's been saved by a thin inside edge
Maharaj holds this back outside off, patted to the covers
full and straight, Bancroft deploys a solid stride and drives a single down to long-on
breaks back in from wide of the crease, prodded in the air but wide of short leg
tossed on off, Khawaja stretches out and smothers it
Khawaja attempts a  reverse-sweep from outside off. He can only toe-end it to slip
Bancroft rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and punches up to the covers
full and veering down leg, deflected away fine on the leg side
left alone outside off
back of a length and angling across off, Khawaja leaves it be
much fuller and sliding across off at 133ks, left alone again
back of a length and angling away, finishes on a fourth-stump line. Khawaja simply pats it down to cover
tossed up and drifts in on middle, Bancroft presses forward and runs it to short midwicket's left
Delightfully done, Bancroft. Floated up on middle, he steps away outside leg, collapses his back leg and lifts it inside out over mid-off
pushed through on off stump, driven along the ground to long-off. Mid-off had been pushed back after that four
clipped with the break to the left of forward short leg

tossed up and full enough for the sweep or the reverse. Khawaja stretches out, rolls out his wrists, and guides the ball away through the vacant spaces at backward point. Excellent execution of the reverse sweep
flatter and turning in, Khawaja dinks it away behind square on the leg side and hares back for three. Given as leg byes
short on middle, Khawaja hops and fends it back
back of a length and angling away outside off, ignored
rising short ball on off, angling away from over the wicket, Khawaja hops, skips and fends it down again
back of a length and angling across off, ignored
back of a length and fizzing away outside off, Khawaja does not bother with it
full on off, hangs back and works the ball to mid-on
pushed through on off stump, clipped to the left of midwicket
slower through the air and drifts in, defended to the leg side off the inside edge
hung up in the air, drops, and turns sharply past the outside edge
full on middle, played back to the bowler
pushed through very full on the leg stump, Bancroft goes low, and paddles it very fine. Nobody there to cut if off
drifts in, turns, takes the outside edge and rolls to point
back of a length and angling away just outside off, Khawaja sits back and defends to the leg side
fuller on off stump, Khawaja blocks again
full and attacking the stumps, defended back to the bowler
short and shoved down leg, Khawaja does not chase after it
short and skidding on just outside off, Khawaja hops and drops it down

Ngidi finds the outside edge but it does not carry to AB at first slip. It bursts through the cordon for four. This was much, much fuller, angling away, and seaming away. Khawaja is opened up as he jabs at the ball and gets away with it
tossed up full on middle, driven back to Maharaj
drifts in on off, forward-defensive from Bancroft
dips at leg stump, creates distance between the bat and the pitch. Prodded to midwicket
tossed on off, hint of turn, Bancroft presses forward and smothers it
hung up in the air, drops outside off, steered off the face to backward point
turn and bounce outside off, no shot, maiden
good length and darted outside off, Khawaja presses forward and shoulders arms
full and wide, carved away behind point. He has to settle for one

What have you done, Bancroft? What a soft end to an otherwise solid innings. Floated full and outside off, Bancroft simply reaches out for the ball with his hands and brings his bat down at an awkward angle. An inside edge trickles back onto the base of off stump and the off bail gets dislodged. Bancroft sees off the new ball but doesn't cash in again

... and he sets to work with a first-ball four. Death, taxes, and Steven Smith jumping across off to whip balls to the leg-side boundaries. He shuffles across and twirls this middle-stump ball to the right of square leg
back of a length and outside off, punched to the covers
good length and outside off, no shot
lobbed up outside off, turns back in to take the inside edge but does not carry to short leg
shorter and clipped off the hips to short midwicket
Khawaja steps out and clips it with the break to deep square
tossed up and drifts into the middle of Smith's front-foot defence
Maharaj pulls his length back, starts on off, makes Smith play, and breaks past the outside edge
slid through much fuller on the stumps, kept out
full and holds its line outside off, ignored
full and holds its line again but it's closer to off this time as Khawaja hangs his bat out and misses
full and wide - wider than a set of stumps outside off - left alone
slightly back of a length, angling in from wide of the crease, Khawaja plays for the angle but it straightens away past the outside edge
and again! Much fuller, angling in just outside off and tailing away past the bat
short on leg stump, deflected to square leg
floated on off stump, Smith stays leg-side of the ball and pushes to cover
pushed through on off, defended
here comes Smith! He twinkles down the track and launches it inside-out over mid-off. Philander, who was at mid-off, has now been sent to the deep. Gorgeous timing from Smith
shorter and outside off, stabbed to cover
pitches on middle and leg, spins away, jabbed to point
shorter and spins away outside off, hit back to the bowler
on a length and kicks up, Khawaja looses his grip and gloves it to the cordon
just short of a good length, lifts and moves away as Khawaja hangs his bat out again
really full on off, Rabada catches Khawaja on the crease again. An outside edge streaks away past the cordon and down to third man
wide yorker, squeezes under Smith's bat
just short of a good length and outside off, played back to the bowler
full and snaking back in, Smith plays around his front pad, but this was heading down leg with the sharp angle
pushed through on middle, down the track and forced down to long-on
glanced away behind square on the leg side
floated up on off, forward defensive

Maharaj reels in the big fish. The big fish walks off, and Maharaj is mobbed by his team-mates. Maharaj loops a full ball up on middle and off and gets it to break away and bounce. Smith plays back and wafts at it. He feathers it behind and he knows it. De Kock rides the bounce and snags a sharp catch behind the stumps. Australia are still 62 runs behind
whipped with the break to short midwicket off the back foot
starts outside off and rips back in to beat the inside edge and hit the thigh pad
full and outside off, no shot
pitched up and outside off again, no lateral movement, left alone again
Khawaja shimmies out, Philander holds his own and probes away outside off. Left alone in the end
back of a length and outside off, left alone
fast legbreak runs away outside off as Khawaja stabs at it and misses
kicks up from a back of a length outside off, Khawaja goes after it but is beaten
clipped with the break to square leg
tossed outside off, Khawaja runs down the track and drills a drive against the break through extra cover
fuller and outside off, pushed into the covers
Khawaja skips out again, meets the pitch, takes a half-volley and creams it to the cover boundary
pitches a long way outside off and spins in, Khawaja kicks it away with his pad
skids on outside off and turns in quickly, Khawaja hurriedly prods it to midwicket
angles a full delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, Marsh is overbalanced as he squeezes this back down the pitch

there's the poke and he's gone. This is a nothing shot from Marsh. He was neither going for a full-blooded drive nor was he intending to leave that. Credit to Rabada, pitched this up and got this to move away just a hint to drag him into the stroke, got the faintest of edges through to de Kock. Trouble, trouble for Australia
back of length delivery outside off, left alone
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends.
right on top of the bounce as he defends with soft hands
floated full outside off, left alone
back of length outside off, left alone
leans forward and drives this incoming delivery to short mid-off
invites the drive by pitching this up outside off, Khawaja leaves
width and he's put that away easily. Rocked back and smashed the cut behind point. Quality stroke
induces the edge. Khawaja is squared up as he hops back to defend, this one races past second slip to the third man boundary. Minimal feet movement
swerves back in from outside off, Khawaja leaves. This wasn't far from the off stump
touch ahead of length outside off, left alone
ducks under this short ball. He's working up some pace
angles in a short of length delivery on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
bunts this short of length delivery into the off side with soft hands
probing length outside off again, left alone
leading edge as he hops across to defend, lands short of point.
steps out and whips this full delivery down to long-on
fired full on off, Marsh lunges forward and blocks
hint of turn but he's got the line well covered as he defends
stretches forward and defends this tossed up delivery with the bat well ahead of his pads
drifts in a full ball on off stump, defended to cover

uppish but just wide of point. Ngidi runs around the ropes from deep cover to put in a dive and prevent the ball from crossing over. Top work, first to get to the ball, then to dive. All this for two runs.
excellent stop by Elgar at gully. Khawaja looked to punch this through point but got a thick edge.
shows the full face of the bat in defence of this incoming length ball
down leg, this races away to the fine leg boundary. Easy pickings for Khawaja, who simply tickles this away. Too easy
length outsiee off, left alone.
squeezes the drive to backward point
stands tall and defends this back of length delivery outside off to cover
drifts in a full delivery that he looks to squeeze out, but gets a bottom edge that bounces thorough to de Kock, who dives to his left to stop that
rooted to the crease as he defends this 'in-between' length ball. Wasn't sure whether to go forward or back
rocks back and cuts this shot ball to deep point
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks with the pad
steps out, in doing so, gets himself outside the line as he smothers the spin with his pad
nicely-controlled reverse sweep, all along the ground to the third man boundary
punches this length ball to Maharaj at cover
solid backfoot defense to this length ball on off stump
nips back in to thud into the thigh pad as he looks to work it to the leg side. They steal a legbye
sliding into the pads, Khawaja hops across and whips this to the fine leg boundary. That's the second boundary in that region post tea. He's looking quite comfortable now
back of length delivery, gets this to lift off the surface, but it was angling away. Left alone
lunges forward and drives to short mid-off.
right into the blockhole, squeezed back to the bowler
lunges forward and eases this with the spin to short cover
drift and turn from leg stump, squirted towards point
nice line, held it back a touch to force Marsh to lunge forward, defended solidly
right into the blockhole again, defended
eased with the spin to deep cover
length ball that swerves away just a touch from outside off, left alone
forces this off the backfoot to cover. Can't pick the gap
nips back in to hit the top of the pad, but this was sliding down
back of length outside off, this one climbs on Marsh but he lets it go. Taken chest height by de Kock
works this incoming length delivery into the leg side with soft hands
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends
gets this full delivery to shape away from outside off, Khawaj's feet rooted to the crease as he pushes this to cover
good leave. This is a tight leave too. Angles a length ball back in from wide of the crease, wasn't far from the off stump
beaten as he shapes to fetch a pull from way outside off.
gets this to snake back in from wide of the crease, Khawaja shows the full face of the bat in defence
defends this length ball from the crease to the off side
driven but straight to mid-of.
drifts in a full ball on the stumps from around the wicket, defended back
eased with the spin to short cover
rocks back and punches this length ball to cover
drifts into middle and leg, Marsh lunges forward and smothers this
sees some air on this but is happy to ease this back gently to short mid-off
skids back in with the arm, Marsh steers this down to deep cover
shot of the evening. This was short and angling in, Marsh got inside the line and pummeled this pull over midwicket.
floats this full on off stump, defended from the crease
angled in towards the stumps from wide of the crease, squirted to the off side.
good stride forward, perfect balance as he defends this full delivery back

was it missing leg? Marsh is truck on the pad, fell over a touch as he looked to work this past midwicket. Faf consults with his mates and reviews the decision. Remember, this had to hit more than half of leg stump for it to be reversed. Ball tracking suggests this would've missed leg stump by a long way.
short of length and way outside off, left alone
turns this gently into the gap at midwicket to bring up his 11th Test fifty
cracked to the point boundary at the rate of knots. Transferred his weight back to give this a whack. Too short from  Maharaj
drifts into middle and leg, he lunges forward and blocks
skids back in, keeps a touch low but Marsh defends somehow
gets the bat well in front of the pad as he defends
drills this full delivery to mid-on
length on off from around the stumps, defended towards point
mistimes a drive to mid-off. Went for an expansive drive
slides a full delivery down leg, Khawaja looks for the fine tickle but misses.
full toss that bends back in, defended back towards the bowler, who can't put his right foot out. Faf stops it at mid-off
superb one-handed stop at extra cover by Markram. This was driven firmly by Khawaja out of the rough
punches this length ball to extra cover
short of length outside off from around the stumps, left alone. On the bounce to de Kock
gets this full ball to bend back in, hit the deck and then straighten. Khawaja is beaten. Fortunately for him, he played inside the line. Hint of reverse for Rabada
right behind the line of this length ball as he bunts into the off side
angles in a short ball into the body, Khawaja looks to hop back and whip that square but gets a glove on it as the ball rolls to the leg side. They scamper a run
full and swinging away from off stump, left alone
hops back and defends this short of length delivery back towards Rabada
over the gully region. Cries of 'caaaatch' but there's no way someone would've got that. Reached out to drive this through cover. Handy runs
right back into the crease as he defends this short of length ball back towards the bowler
slants this length ball into middle and leg, defended towards midwicket
full outside off, hint of reverse away, left alone
full and swinging away from outside off, an open invitation to drive, but Khawaja lets it go
full outside off, left alone
tails one back in a long way, Marsh looks to defend, deflects off his thigh pad to fine leg
floats this full on the stumps, Khawaja's feet rooted to the crease as he defends
short of length delivery way outside off, left alone
full outside off, but not enough to get him driving. Left alone
beauty from Rabada. Got this to angle in and straighten to beat the outside edge as Khawaja pushed at that
beaten for pace by this sharp bouncer, he shaped to pull but was in no position. Thudded into the glove and lobbed briefly but there was no one at short leg to snaffle that.
dropped shorter and wider outside off, cut firmly to the off-side sweeper off the back foot
on a length, starts outside off and turns back in at his pads, Khawaja clips it with the turn to deep midwicket
darted very full on middle, so much so it winds up as a full-toss, worked to the leg side
skidder outside off, chopped off the back foot to backward point
flat and skids on outside off again, stabbed off the back foot wide of backward point this time
Khawaja dares to foray down the track. Maharaj is wary of it and he duly pulls his length back. Khawaja wears it on the thigh pad and the ball loops into the lap of short leg
short and outside off, Marsh gets right behind the line and blocks stoutly
pitched further up and just a shade outside off, he still can't breach through the defences of Marsh
back of a length and heading towards the top of off, Marsh's defensive technique intervenes again
back of a length, angling in and veers away a touch, catches the shoulder of the bat but does not carry to the cordon
back of a length and slanting in at off stump, prodded to backward point
short and wide outside off - possibly wider than a set of stumps - Khawaja watches it through to de Kock
pushed through the air, slides in on middle, blocked
Marsh jumps back to meet this short ball outside off and forces to the covers
on a length and spins away outside off, Marsh deploys a solid stride and blocks with the break to point
shorter and faster outside off, he goes on the back foot and punches the ball up to mid-off
fuller and outside off, driven through the line to cover
loopier and drifts in at off stump, Marsh covers up his castle and defends to the off side
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Khawaja swishes his bat out of the way
back of a length and outside off again, no shot again
shorter and outside off, nothing doing from Khawaja
Rabada keeps darting it short and wide, Khawaja keeps leaving it
back of a length in the channel, left alone yet again
good length and slanting in at off stump, Khawaja, surely, has to play at this. He loosens his grip and lets the ball slide off the face to gully
tossed on middle, Marsh stretches out and plays it back to the bowler
full on middle, driven back to the bowler
slides in on middle, jabbed back to the bowler again
flighted on middle, blocked again. SA building pressure
tossed on middle, forward and run back to Maharaj again
dragged down outside off, back-foot force to sweeper cover. First runs for Australia after 18 dots
full and just a shade outside off, dabbed off the face to the cordon
full on middle, pushed down to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Marsh gets right behind the line and tightly defends to short cover
fuller than a good length and nips back in, Marsh prods outside the line of it and squirts an inside edge onto the thigh pad
pitched up and outside off, confidently pushed off the front foot to wide mid-off
full and sliding into the pads, Khawaja picks it off to the right of long leg. Australia move into the lead
tossed just outside off, Khawaja sweeps with the turn to deep midwicket
looped on leg stump, steered behind point with soft hands
skidding into the thigh, punched off the back foot to deep midwicket
pitches outside leg and turns away, dead-batted back to the bowler
tickled off the pads but straight to short fine leg
pitches outside leg and spins, Marsh goes back, sizes it up and defends back to Maharaj

Philander whips around for an lbw appeal, but umpire Ravi shoots it down. Philander coaxes Faf into a review. Nice and full, slanting in at leg stump from around the wicket. Philander catches Khawaja on the crease. He plays around his front pad and gets away as it is heading down the leg side. SA have lost both their reviews
back of a length and bends back in, inside-edged onto the flap of the front pad
Marsh rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and places it between point and cover
back of a length and just a shade outside off, jabbed into the covers

Philander finds the outside edge but there's no-one at second slip to catch it. Fuller than a good length, angling in at off, curves away. Khawaja is pinned to the crease as he jabs it to the left of Amla at first slip
full and straight, tapped to midwicket
tossed outside leg, worked to midwicket
pitches outside leg and spins away, blocked back
darted outside leg, ripe for the sweep, Marsh latches onto it and sweeps it flat and hard past short fine leg's left. He doesn't usually sweep but has nailed this to the boundary
flighted on middle and breaks away, played to slip with soft hands
Maharaj draws the batsman forward with a fuller length and turn. Tapped to backward point
round-arm slider, dead-batted
back of a length on middle, tip and run to the right of cover
full and angling in on middle, defended
back of a length and outside off, run away to the left of backward point
on a length and outside off, patted to cover
short and attached with width outside off, Marsh is prepared to wait, wait, and wait for such bad balls. He times a cut to the left of backward point
full and straight, blocked watchfully
short and wide outside off, breaks away, Khawaja flashes and misses. Loose ball, loose shot, loose cricket all around
back of a length and spins away outside off, steered away to the right of backward point. Marsh takes off for a single and has slid his bat in to beat the throw from Klaasen
clipped off the pads between midwicket and square leg
tossed on off stump, defended to the off side
straight ball outside off, bounces, left alone
tossed on middle, defended back
fuller than a good length and outside off, ignored
back of a length and outside off, ignored again
tight lines on off, Marsh gets right behind it
fuller and pushed outside off, left alone
short, wide, flayed to deep point
pretty full and outside off, pops up, Khawaja checks his drive and chips it just over mid-off. The ball raises a puff of dust
clipped off the pads to square leg
back of a length on middle, defended back to the bowler
skids on middle and leg, tapped to mid-on
floated on middle, worked to the leg side again
tossed on middle, forward and smothered
whipped away off the back foot to short midwicket
very full and outside off, sticks in the surface, checks his drive and chips to mid-off
back of a length, angling in from round the wicket and straightening past the hanging bat
very full and outside off, driven through the line past the covers
short and angled in at the top of off, Khawaja jumps off the ground and glides the ball behind point
pitched up and outside off, Marsh holds his shape and check-drives the ball to mid-off
low full-toss on off, pushed down to mid-off
tossed outside off, Khawaja rolls his wrists and sweeps to fine leg
tossed on middle, played back to the bowler
off-stump yorker, jabbed to cover
full on middle and leg, turned away to midwicket
short on the leg stump, nurdled to square leg
short on middle and leg, swatted to midwicket off the back foot

Rabada returns and pins Khawaja in front with seven minutes to go for stumps. Khawaja chats with Marsh and decides against a review. This looked pretty adjacent and the three reds confirm it. Rabada lets out a roar and celebrates. Speared full on middle and tails away late to beat Khawaja's outside edge and ping the back pad. It would have carried onto hit the top of off stump. Khawaja's tendency to camp back in the crease works against him in the end
wide of the crease, angled in outside off, Paine shoulders arms
very full and outside off, presses forward and drives to mid-off. The throw from Faf hits the back of Paine. The SA captain puts his hand up in apology right away
pitched up and outside off, left alone
very full, wide of the crease, angling in, pushed to mid-on
wide of the crease again, full and angling in, pushed back to the bowler
fired short and outside off, back-foot force to sweeper cover
nice and full, drifts in and spins away, Paine plays back to it and nicks it off but to the left of slip. It did not carry to AB
slid in on middle, Marsh stays leg-side of the ball and caresses the  ball through the vacant spaces at cover
sliding outside leg as Paine does not get close to the pitch of the ball and misses the leg-side flick
round-arm slider on leg stump, bunted through midwicket
arm ball on middle, Marsh gets right behind the line and keeps it out
goes wide of the crease and bowls full on middle stump, Marsh drives to mid-on

drives aerially but it lands short of the diving Elgar at extra cover. Loose shot from Marsh, looking to drive without getting close to the ball on the front foot. Goes through with the shot and it's a drive on the up in the end. A big puff of dust as that ball landed on the pitch
full and marginal movement away from the corridor. Solidly behind this time as he pushes on the front foot and steers it through point
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot

struck in front of middle and the lbw appeal is turned down. He was wide of the crease again and this shaped back a touch. Appears to have gotten an inside edge as he looks to nudge this into the leg side...yes he has.

bowled him! Boom, right through the defence. They've checked for no-ball, he's fine. What a sight. Marsh is an unfortunate man to get this ball so early in the day. Nips in off the seam from outside off - the shiny side is pointed towards leg side - and clips his front leg back thigh before knocking off stump. He's looking to defend but the stride isn't quite there in the first over of the day
dropped marginally short outside off and Paine shifts his weight into a very handsome punch on the up, past extra cover
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the covers
beats the outside edge. Angles in at off, nips off the seam as he looks to defend
full on middle stump, flicked to mid-on off the front foot

good length and in at the pads. Allows it to come on and dabs it fine. Ngidi is at long leg and has a chase to his right. Puts in a slide and pulls it back in, but he can't stop the momentum and the ball rolls towards him as he touches it while outside the boundary
good length and wobbly at a middle stump line. Defended solidly into the leg side

that's mean from Rabada. 141kph bouncer rising sharply at Paine's back shoulder. He hangs the bat up fr the hook but that fizzes past him. And he nearly falls onto the stumps. Anyone other than a keeper might have struggled to stay up, I imagine.
good length outside off, nudged through point off the front foot
back of a length, slanted into the corridor before cutting away. He leaves with off stump exposed
good length and in at off stump. Solidly blocked on the front foot
thuds his pad on the full but that's going down. Might have been an attempted yorker
yorker fired down leg side. QDK leaps and manages to get his left-hand on it. Can't gather but he's taken the fizz out and Amla cleans up
oh clattered. Good shot from Paine. Quickly onto the back foot, it's a more friendly bouncer from Philander. He sends it to the midwicket boundary
good length and just outside off. Dabbed into the off side off the front foot
back of a length just outside off, left alone
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
good length on leg stump, clipped to long leg with the angle
back of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
full and in at off stump, pushed into the covers on the front foot

steers it to gully! Five wickets in the innings, ten in the game for Rabada. Short of a length ball nips away from outside off. Cummins stays leg side of it and jabs away from the body. Theunis de Bruyn is really close at gully, and he snaps it up to his left with a tumble
bouncer angled in at a leg stump line. He's forced to duck
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length and in at off stump. Pushes into the leg side off the inside half
bouncer and he gets under it to leave. Dies on QDK who lunges forward to take
good length and n at middle stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, punched to deep point
good length and slanted across off stump. Defended to point off the front foot
inswinger strikes him on the pad but this pitching on leg stump and going down leg. Reverse swing, that. Starc couldn't get bat on the flick.
good length outside off, looks to drive on the up and gets it to mid-on off the inside half
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg
good length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off. Left alone

outside edge? Yes. Starc drives inside the line, the ball straightens outside off and it's a faint edge. As regulation as it can get in Test cricket. It's on a length and he's looking for a big drive on the up
bouncer slanted down leg side, left alone
full and into the pads. Nicely flicked off the toes, but straight to square leg
outswinger. A long way outside off and Lyon reaches out to guide this through point on the up
short of a length just outside off, punched to deep cover off the back foot
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off's left on the up
good length outside off, left alone
full on middle stump, pushed to mid-on with soft hands
back of a length and swung in at middle stump. Tapped into the leg side off the back foot
chips towards mid-on and it falls short. It's a full ball on middle and he looks to shovel this on the up. The balls sits in the pitch
nearly flicks a full toss to short midwicket. Comes in from wide of the crease and he checks the shot
inside edge to the keeper on the bounce. Looks to pull this short ball from wide outside off
short ball down leg side, left alone
short of a length and swinging away outside off, swipes and misses
good length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length and in at off stump, defended from the crease

outside edge and that's the end of Lyon. Australia are now 72 for 9 effectively. Reverse swing from Ngidi, inwards and full at off stump. Straightens off the pitch and Lyon gets a thin edge as he looks to drive
bouncer at off stump, defended uppishly off the back foot
short ball into the ribs. He stands tall and tickles this fine. Rabada slides to his left there and stops
good length and in at leg stump. Flicked to fine leg
fires the bouncer wayyyyy down leg side. Hazlewood grateful as he leaves
good length and just outside off. Left alone
good shot. Looks so good when he plays the hook. Rises above the bounce at off stump, stretches his arms out and bisects fine leg and deep square with a well controlled shot into the ground
good length and swinging away late outside off, dabbed into the covers on the up
short ball on leg stump, rises above the bounce and dabs it into the square leg region with soft hands
good length just outside off. Hazlewood exposes off stump as he looks to defend. Rabada misses it narrowly
good length just outside off, defended off the inside half
short of a length slider just outside off. Backs away and looks to cut, beaten
length outside off, pushed back to the bowler
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on off, blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked to mid-on
lovely shot from Hazlewood. A perfectly controlled sweep to manipulate the field and pick up four. Shuffles into the off side and places it behind square
short of a length outside off, steered to third man with an open face
full on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length just outside off. Drops it into the gully region with soft hands and it's kept to one
strikes the pad but that is missing leg. Ngidi fires it full from around the wicket and Hazlewood is rooted to the crease as he looks to flick
full and fired down leg side. Can't get bat on this
full ball down leg side again. QDK gathers and looks in the bowler's direction with an expression that says, 'you kidding me man?'
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full on leg stump, nudged to mid-on off the front foot
beaten as he looks to sweep again. Less control this time, more swat. It spins into him and over the bat outside off
full outside off, flicked uppishly to deep square off the front foot
full and in at leg stump. Clipped past square leg off the front foot
good length outside off, defended off the inside edge on the front foot
back of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
good length and down leg side. Leans in and looks to flick, can't get bat on it
good length and in at off stump. Inside edge onto boot as he blocks on the front foot
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and in at leg stump. Thuds him on the pad as he looks to flick. Going down leg
good length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
nails the big sweep but can't get it past midwicket. Hazlewood has one shot and he will play it. Picks this from wide outside off
another sweep. Gets it over square leg this time and well to deep square's left. Again, picks this length ball from way outside off stump
full and wide outside off, plonks the front leg forward and swats this forcefully to long-on
full on off stump, driven to long-off
clears the midwicket boundary with a slog sweep. Maharaj getting a bit of his own medcine. Hazlewood relentlessly going after him and this time he's got it right off the middle

holes out to deep midwicket. Maharaj keeps hanging it outside off, Hazlewood takes the bait again and goes for the slog sweep. No attempt to keep it down and it appears he's got this off the toe. It dips on the fielder in the deep and he takes it comfortably
full inswinger on the pads, flicked hurriedly to fine leg
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot as it spits up at him
short of a length and wide outside off. Left alone
good length outswinger, wide outside off. Left alone
full outside off, defended on the front foot
decides to leave late and steers this onto his pad off the face of the bat. Tentative from Elgar, pushing forward in the corridor
good length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
full outswinger outside off, left alone
shot. Glorious punch through the covers. Hazlewood misses his length a tad, on the shorter side outside off and Markram stands tall and places this in front of square
back of a length outside off, goes back, dabs it softly to sweeper point's right

dropped by Mitchell Marsh at first slip. Oh a great delivery from Hazlewood and this wasn't a difficult chance by any means. Shape away from the corridor, drawing a shot from the batsman - the perfect ball. It flies low to Marsh's right and he comes down too slowly
shot, but no run. Another solid punch off the back foot but he can't beat extra cover
into the mid-riff as he goes on the back foot to defend this length ball
good length and just outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length wide outside off, left alone
good length on off stump, solidly blocked down the pitch and it manages to sneak past Starc. Mid-off gives chase
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length and swung away outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length and just outside off. Neatly punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
nibbles at it and withdraws. Probing away, Hazlewood. Just outside off with a bit of wobble
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, dabbed into the covers off the back foot
in the box. Wouldn't be an Elgar innings otherwise. Starc gets this to angle in and lift from a length as Elgar leans in to defend
nicely timed. Full ball on the pads, nudged past midwicket and Cummins gives a long chase from wide mid-on
good length on middle stump, off the thick outside edge as he offers the full face to defend
in the air but it's four to third man. Markram looks to drive on the up and has lost control of the shot. Chasing a long way out, thick outside edge flies over the backward point region
gorgeous. Inswinger onto the toe, he shuffles quickly, opens his body up, stands tall and punches this to the midwicket boundary

superb catch off his own bowling. Drifts this in at a length, on middle stump. Elgar leans in and looks to flick. Gets a leading edge that dies on Lyon who - replays confirm - has got his fingers under it as he lunges forward
some flight outside off, the ball spins back in, inside-edged into the pad. That's a good length.
shortish on the pads, worked away towards square leg for a run.
short, spinning back in towards Aiden, defended from the back foot.
too straight this time, clipped away to square leg for nothing.
tidy start from Garry! On a length outside off, turning back in, right behind the line.
a full delivery outside off, a thick inside edge down to fine leg. Just a hint of inward movement.
full on middle and off, hits the outside half of the bat towards point.
full and wide, the ball moving away, left alone, 132 kph
lovely drive. Overpitched and straight, Markram nails that back, full face of the bat. Hazlewood gets down and half-stops it. Two to mid-off
full and straight again, 132 kph, the ball moving back in, punched to mid-on
full and attacking the stumps again, driven to mid-on
short and turning down leg, Amla just watches that go.
very watchful in defense as Amla stays back
85 kph, flat outside off, pushed into the off side
83 kph, left alone, struck on the pad, an appeal. No. Flat outside off, left alone by Amla.
more flight outside off, the ball hits pad then bat. Another appeal, another no. Australia think he hasn't offered a stroke, his bat thrusting behind the pad.
no appeal for this. It's tossed up outside off, drilled through cover for four.
full and wide, the ball moving away, nicely left alone
on a length on middle and leg, 132 kph, worked to square leg for nothing.
into the gap at midwicket for two. On a length, nicely worked away. Not over-hitting, just relying on timing.
shortish and wide, slapped to cover from the back foot

edged and taken! Too good from Hazlewood. Australia not giving up. It's another stunning delivery, on a good length, the ball moving away. Markram is lulled into playing because of the threat of reverse swing and the threat of bowled or lbw. It doesn't come in, it goes away. Takes the outside edge, flies in between first and second slip. But Smith steps up, moves well to his left and takes a smart catch. Excellent stuff
87 kph, short outside off, worked away to deep square leg.
flight outside off, AB looks to drive, hit away through cover with bad timing.
82 kph, short outside off, coming back in, off the pad towards slip as Amla shoulders arms.
short outside off, turning back in, 85 kph

84 kph, big appeal! No again. Smith again thinks he has not offered a shot, but what Amla is doing is putting the bat behind the pad. It depends on the umpire, what he thinks. He was struck well outside the line there.

this is a better appeal, Australia review this time. Flat outside off, turning back in, hits Amla in front of off, or just outside the line. On a pitch with plenty of turn, it's always a problem that the ball is turning too much. Think Amla has been struck in line, but Lyon is bowling from over the wicket, so the ball was always going to miss the leg stump, as HawkEye indicates.
full outside off, the ball moving away, outside-halved to point.
shortish outside off, hit to mid-off.
picks the length early and says I'm going to score my way, mate. Back of a length around off, pulled over square leg for four. Lovely proactive, de Villiers-type batting.
back of a length down leg, 137 kph, nudged to fine leg for a run
back of a length outside off, 135 kph, outside-halved towards gully
136 kph, on the pads, nudged away to square leg
shorter outside off, turning in, nudged to deep square leg
87 kph, beaten on the spin is backward point. Flat outside off, AB reverse-paddles him away. The ball goes through
shortish and slow down leg, nudged to square leg

this is batting at its very best. Making tough batting conditions look like batting in your own backyard, where you set the rules, the bowlers and the fields. Runs down the pitch and flicks the ball over midwicket. His power and wrists do the rest.
slightly leg side-ish, nudged away to square leg
flat around off, inside-edged away towards fine leg
wow, when does Hazlewood lose his line often? Probably when AB is batting. Short, wide and carved away through point. Piece of chocolate cake.
full and wide outside off, 139 kph, left alone.
133 kph, another good leave, full and wide, left alone

136 kph. Is this a better innings than his first innings? Wow. Awesome batting. Overpitched around off, he drills a straight drive right back from where it came. Full face. Hazlewood can't get down in time.
good length outside off, goes slightly wider of the crease, defends to point
full around off, awkwardly behind the line is AB there.
some flight outside off, inside-edged towards short leg
91 kph, overpitched on middle, pushed to long-on
the dart. Full outside off, pushed in front of point for one. Amla called for that
shortish and spinning down leg, worked to deep square leg.
flat outside off, he goes back and punches back to the bowler
slower down leg, nudged to short leg
a top edge for four. Short outside off, that's not a shot Amla would play, he'd normally cut that. Off the leading edge, over the keeper, four.
good length around off, defended back
overpitched outside off, 138 kph. Amla leans into a drive but finds short cover.
back of a length around off, 135 kph, blocked back
133 kph, short outside off, punched away towards wide mid-off. Warner dives to his left, saves three.
short down leg, an ODI wide, not in Tests.
on the pads, flicked away discernibly earlier to hit it in front of square.
short down leg, nudged to short fine leg.
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off
shortish, quick, straight, nudged to midwicket
the flatter slider outside off, doesn't bounce much either, goes underneath Amla's bat.
93 kph, overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off for a run
good length around off, 136 kph, defended back
full outside off, 135 kph, a thick inside edge as the ball flies off the inside half to square leg.
excellent shot again. Overpitched outside off, caressed towards cover, parries it away towards mid-off as he dives to his right
a full delivery outside off, tapped away to point
back of a length outside off, 139 kph, pushed towards point.
full delivery outside off, left alone by AB
overpitched around off, Amla gets forward and smothers the ball.

a tad wider outside off, 96 kph, chopped away towards point. Mitch Marsh chases it down, but the ball trickles back into the boundary cushion. Or did it stop just before? Think it just stopped. So three.
some flight outside off, driven to long-on for one
slow outside off, Amla defends from the front foot
short and wide outside off, Amla rocks right back and slices this towards the third man boundary. Easy runs for a man of Amla's class.
too straight, worked away to deep square leg for ne.
drifts down leg, leg-side wide in white ball cricket.
full and wide, the ball moving away late, but beats the bat as Amla drives. Well bowled.

edged and gone! Amla nicks off. It's full, swinging away. SA are in touching distance so he goes through with a waft, unlike Amla. Is not in control of the drive, the ball takes the outside edge to T-Paine.
overpitched around off, blocked to mid-on
good length outside off, left alone nicely

straight to short leg. 94 kph. That's an excellent piece of bowling from Lyon. He sees AB coming and shortens the length just a touch, which means the ball isn't full. AB works the ball away into the leg side, but short leg is patrolling that region. He stays low, moves forward with the batsman, sees the ball off the face and takes a catch inches from the ground. Terrific piece of cricket from Lyon and Bancroft.
every run is going to be cheered now. Full outside off, a thick inside edge down to fine leg, who runs to his right and misfields.
93 kph, tossed up outside off, swept away to deep midwicket. A cameo of 10 from someone should do this.
slow around off, defended out.

94 kph, that's four. SA do not care how it comes. Byes! Flat outside off, the ball spins down leg. Faf looks to sweep, was there some glove? It beats the keeper and short leg and runs down for four to fine leg
tossed up outside off, defended into the off side.
146 kph, full outside off, worked away to mid-on
well bowled, the one that goes away outside off. And a good leave too
a short delivery outside off, de Bruyn lets this one go.
back of a length outside off, 142 kph, another leave
full and straight, the ball moving in. De Bruyn somehow got bat on that, one to fine leg.
139 kph, overpitched outside off, driven away to mid-off
slow and flat and straight, smothered back.
nicely done. Sees some flight and it's full and wide, so he opens the bat face and guides the ball through cover.
on the bounce to deep square leg. Flat outside off, some turn. Swept away with bad timing. Single-digits now
a hard sweep to deep square leg. 94 kph. 8 now, the countdown has begun.
slow on the pads, worked to short fine leg
four of them. Shortish and wide, carved away in front of point for four. Good batting from de Bruyn.
digs this in, Faf gets underneath
full outside off, pushed towards mid-off
139 kph, on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg for one
short, outside off, de Bruyn this time gets underneath
full outside off, drilled through cover. SA level the series 1-1. No man there, vast expanses. And SA bounce back after Durban. Port Elizabeth is theirs, in a Test against Australia again.
